Federico Lombardi, said that the ecumenical question between the Roman Catholic and Orthodox Churches, whose relationship has been tense since the two churches divided nearly 1,000 years ago, was not discussed.

title: Why Care About the N.S.A.?
description: Like many Americans and people around the world, I was deeply disturbed to hear the revelations of Edward Snowden about N.S.A. surveillance, which is an affront to the United States Bill of Rights. But as a filmmaker who has made a number of documentaries about technology and online activism, I cant say that Snowdens revelations came as a surprise. Some concerned citizens have long understood that powerful digital technologies can be abused to carve away at civil liberties.

title: Report Retraces Six Minutes of Horror, and Every Step a Gunman Took
description: At 9:30 a.m. on Dec. 14, in Room 9 of Sandy Hook Elementary School, the principal, psychologist, and other staff members had gathered for a meeting about student placement.

title: Suit Accuses Rikers Officers of Illegal Strike
description: Lawyers for New York City filed a lawsuit on Monday against the correction officers union, accusing it of an illegal strike last week that prevented hundreds of inmates on Rikers Island from reaching court.

title: Jean Banchet, Chef Who Translated French Cuisine, Dies at 72
description: Jean Banchet, a dashing chef whose traditional French cooking helped make the Chicago suburbs a global destination for food lovers in the 1970s and 80s, died on Sunday at his home in Jupiter, Fla. He was 72.

title: Virginia: Democrat Certified as Attorney General
description: Mark R. Herring, a Democrat, was certified by the State Board of Elections as Virginias next attorney general on Monday, but he may face a recount in a race he won by just 165 votes out of 2.2 million cast. Both Mr. Herring and his Republican opponent, Mark D. Obenshain, have formed transition committees. Mr. Obenshain, who has 10 days to request a recount, issued a statement calling the Nov. 5 vote the closest statewide election in modern Virginia history. He said the choice to press a recount is not one to be made lightly. Both sides have lawyers at the ready for a recount battle. There is a nuclear option: to contest the election, which would throw it into the state House of Delegates. Republicans hold a majority there.

title: The Iran Deal: Praise and Blame
description: To the Editor:

title: Plans Call for Reinforcements at Johannes Leonardo
description: A BOUTIQUE agency that is becoming increasingly known for its unconventional creative output is bringing in its first chief executive to lead additional growth efforts.

title: Catholics and Abortion
description: To the Editor:

title: Praised by de Blasio, Dinkins Responds With an Arrow
description: To punctuate an impassioned pitch for his signature plan to raise taxes on the wealthy, Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio went out of his way during a speech on Monday to praise a cherished political mentor and former boss watching from the audience.

title: PreCheck Meets Its Goal, and Prepares to Expand
description: THE Transportation Security Administration says it has met its goal of having 25 percent of air travelers using the speedy PreCheck security lanes by the end of this year.

title: Last Call for the Long Haul From Singapore to Newark
description: What seemed like a corporate holiday party had broken out near Gate B6 at Singapores Changi Airport.

title: Cellphones on the Plane
description: To the Editor:

title: Israelis See Ticking Clock, and Alternate Approaches, on Iran and Palestinians
description: JERUSALEM  Israeli leaders on Monday condemned the interim deal on Irans nuclear program as an exercise in appeasement by the Western powers and a delaying tactic by Iran. Yet many of them see the same strategy of interim confidence-building steps as the only realistic route to resolving their long-running conflict with the Palestinians.

title: Emissions of Methane in U.S. Exceed Estimates, Study Finds
description: Emissions of the greenhouse gas methane due to human activity were roughly 1.5 times greater in the United States in the middle of the last decade than prevailing estimates, according to a new analysis by 15 climate scientists published Monday in The Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.

title: Bobbie the Builder
description: To the Editor:

title: Treating Opioid Addiction
description: To the Editor:

title: Xbox One Release Follows Familiar Pattern
description: Microsofts Xbox One finished its first weekend on sale, sticking closely to the script that the release of new video game consoles invariably seem to follow.

title: New Clues May Change Buddhas Date of Birth
description: In traditional narratives, Queen Maya Devi, the mother of Buddha, gave birth to him while holding on to a branch of a tree in a garden at Lumbini, in what is now Nepal. Accounts vary as to when this occurred, leaving uncertain the founding century of one of the worlds major religions.

title: Cage Fighter Who Faked Death Is Sentenced in Armed Robbery
description: Charles Rowan, a low-level cage fighter in Michigan who faked his death to escape a debt to a drug dealer, was sentenced Monday to 17  to 40 years in prison after having pleaded guilty to armed robbery.

title: Group to Promote Revised Plan for Tolls on East River Bridges
description: First, the name had to go.

title: Wheelies: The Gallardo Gone Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Render Unto Caesar, but Who Backs Bitcoin?
description: How can bitcoin be anything but a passing fad?

title: After Six Million Miles in the Air, Few Complaints
description: I HAVE traveled my entire career, and now I am traveling more than ever. All these miles for business have helped shape my worldview. I think anyone who travels learns a lot about different cultures, and thats never a negative.

title: Poor Field Conditions Confounding Teams in Moscow
description: MOSCOW  When Bayern Munichs players enter the modest Khimki Arena here for a UEFA Champions League match on Wednesday, their biggest concern might not be the Russian cold or hostile fans or even their opponent, CSKA Moscow. It might be the stadiums worn and weary playing surface.

title: Vestas Hopes to Bring Wind Power to World
description: In recent years, solar energy has emerged as a solution for powering places that lack sufficient electricity, frequently remote areas in developing nations where conventional fuel can be expensive.

title: Bumps in the Road to New Cholesterol Guidelines
description: It was supposed to be a moment of triumph. An august committee had for the first time relied only on the most rigorous scientific evidence to formulate guidelines to prevent heart attacks and strokes, which kill one out of every three Americans. The group had worked for five years, unpaid, to develop them. Then, at the annual meeting of the American Heart Association, it all went horribly awry.

title: In Campaign, Cash Flowed Circuitously
description: Well, thank God. We stumbled out of the mayoral election without watching the conservative Koch brothers grab our little liberal darlings out of their beds, paint them red and register them as Republicans.

title: Egypts Government Struggles to Gain Footing as Dissent Grows
description: CAIRO  When the new military-backed Egyptian government lifted a nationwide state of emergency more than 10 days ago, it seemed to be proclaiming a momentary victory in the battle with its principal foe, the Muslim Brotherhood, whose regular protests had begun to wither.

title: No Way Out: 12 Years a Slave
description: (Readers beware: This column includes a detailed discussion of the films plot. -- The Editors.)

title: Chinas Coercive Play
description: Chinas decision to impose a new air defense zone over a wide swath of the East China Sea is at odds with its claim to want a peaceful resolution to territorial disputes over a group of islands there. The announcement is a highly provocative move that has increased tensions and could make direct conflict with Japan more likely.

title: Mets Send Holiday Cheer, and Mixed Messages
description: The Mets sent their holiday video e-card Monday featuring eight players  the franchises pillars among them  along with Mr. and Mrs. Met, some cartoon backdrops and a flurry of animated snow.

title: New Jersey Goes All In, Online
description: Internet gambling goes live in New Jersey on Tuesday. Its the biggest expansion of the casino business in the state since the 1970s. For gamblers with addiction problems, the process of tapping a paycheck and maxing out a credit card has just become infinitely easier.

title: Caring for Others Was the Right Move to Defeat the Blues
description: There were days when Shawna Simmonds did not want to leave her bed. But it was a sagging spirit, not indolence, that kept her under the covers. Unemployment had left her demoralized.

title: Helpful Definitions for Modern Authors
description: You, Author: Act as Books Publicist, responsible for promotion.

title: A Glimmer of Sense on Guantnamo
description: The Senate, in a little-noticed but positive move, voted last Tuesday to give President Obama new leeway to move toward closing the prison in Guantnamo Bay, Cuba.

title: Defining, and Raising, a Healthy Eater
description: You are what you eat, from your head down to your feet!

title: Bulls Rose to Miss Another Year After Knee Injury
description: CHICAGO  The somber news was delivered in a terse statement from the Chicago Bulls on Monday afternoon. Earlier this morning, Chicago Bulls guard Derrick Rose underwent successful surgery to repair his previously torn medial meniscus in his right knee, it read.

title: End the N.S.A. Dragnet, Now
description: WASHINGTON  THE framers of the Constitution declared that government officials had no power to seize the records of individual Americans without evidence of wrongdoing, and they embedded this principle in the Fourth Amendment. The bulk collection of Americans telephone records  so-called metadata  by the National Security Agency is, in our view, a clear case of a general warrant that violates the spirit of the framers intentions. This intrusive program was authorized under a secret legal process by the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court, so for years American citizens did not have the knowledge needed to challenge the infringement of their privacy rights.

title: ID Verification Lagging on Health Care Website
description: WASHINGTON  Just days before the Obama administrations self-imposed deadline to fix the troubled federal health insurance website, officials said Monday that they were aware of another problem that has prevented thousands of people who were unable to verify their identity from shopping for health plans.

title: The Charity Swindle
description: WASHINGTON  BY all outward indications, the U.S. Navy Veterans Association was a leader in the charitable community. Founded in 2002 to provide support to Navy veterans in need, the charity recorded astonishing financial success. In its first eight years, it raised around $100 million in charitable contributions, almost all of it through a direct marketing campaign. The organization, headed by Jack L. Nimitz, boasted of 41 state chapters and some 66,000 members.

title: At Auction, Bids Are Placed on Vestiges of Koch Era
description: Hows he doing? Even in death, not bad.

title: The North Carolina Five
description: The Uniform Athlete Agents Act was a bill drafted 13 years ago at the urging of the N.C.A.A. The drafters were members of something called the Uniform Law Commission, whose job it is to propose model legislation that the states can then adopt if they so choose. Today, 41 states have the law, or some variant of it, on their books.

title: A Debate Over Paying Board Nominees of Activist Funds
description: When executives serve on a companys board, they are often handsomely compensated.

title: The States Findings on Newtown
description: One of the painful anomalies in the states official report about Decembers school massacre in Newtown, Conn., is the evidence that while Adam Lanza, the shooter who murdered 20 children and six adults, was the object of his mothers great and continuing concern, it did not stop her from writing a check so he might obtain his own pistol in a family already well stocked with firearms.

title: Frustration From a Deal on Flawed Hip Implants
description: Patients injured by a flawed hip implant sold by Johnson & Johnson have directed their anger at myriad places over the years. The regulatory system that allowed the products sale. The company that repeatedly denied problems with the device. Even the doctors who implanted the hips.

title: Judge Is Asked to Toss Out Conviction in 90 Killing of Tourist
description: A decades-old murder case that galvanized public outrage over violent crime in New York was resurrected on Monday, as lawyers for one of the men convicted at trial say they have unearthed new evidence that proves their client was not involved in the attack.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Nov. 25, 2013
Obama Speaks About Immigration Overhaul
description: President Obama made the case for changes in immigration policy in a speech in San Francisco during which a man heckled him.

title: N.S.A. May Have Hit Internet Companies at a Weak Spot
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The recent revelation that the National Security Agency was able to eavesdrop on the communications of Google and Yahoo users without breaking into either companys data centers sounded like something pulled from a Robert Ludlum spy thriller.

title: To Offset Risks Inside, Blazers Star Improves His Outside Shooting
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  Damian Lillard has always had a dependable midrange game, but he spent time developing it over the summer. He was coming off his rookie season with the Portland Trail Blazers, and the league had delivered its hard lessons.

title: Conservative Leads Effort to Raise Minimum Wage in California
description: LOS ANGELES  Ron Unz, a Silicon Valley millionaire, rose to fame by promoting a ballot initiative that essentially eliminated bilingual education in California. He went on to become publisher of The American Conservative, a libertarian-leaning magazine.

title: Obama Calls for Quick Action on Immigration, and So Does a Heckler
description: SAN FRANCISCO  President Obama is often heckled, but it is rare for a guest who is part of a White House-approved backdrop to shout out a protest while the president is in mid-speech.

title: U.S. Relations With Iran Thaw, and  Allies Shiver
F.D.A. Lifts Some Restrictions on Avandia
description: The Food and Drug Administration removed some restrictions on the prescribing and use of the diabetes drug Avandia on Monday, saying that new research showed the drug did not increase the chances of heart attacks.

title: Brooklyn Pantry Struggling to Help Fill Gap Left by Federal Cuts to Food Stamps
description: In the middle of last week, panic set in at the food pantry in Brooklyn run by the Bed-Stuy Campaign Against Hunger.

title: Intellectual Property Protection
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Now, heres a puzzle you can learn something from. I do love it when that happens. Usually, there are only one or two words that I might not know in any given puzzle, but today, the whole theme was a learning experience.

title: Alec Reid, Northern Ireland Priest Who Helped Broker Peace Accord, Dies at 82
description: DUBLIN  The Rev. Alec Reid, an unassuming Roman Catholic priest who played a quiet but crucial role in clandestine negotiations that led to the historic Good Friday peace accord in Northern Ireland in 1998, died here on Friday. He was 82.

title: Officers Are Told Race Can Be a Factor in Street Stops, but Not the Only One
description: The warnings had been dire: A law broadening the types of lawsuits that can be filed over accusations of police profiling would make New York City less safe. It would cut into terrorism investigations and anti-gang initiatives and make police officers wary of stopping suspects on the street.

title: New Pitch for Health Initiative: Mind Your Mom. Get Insured.
description: As the Obama administrations health overhaul sputters in its opening weeks, insurers and advocacy groups are pursuing a new strategy in the quest to get millions of young people to sign up for health insurance: Theyre appealing to their mothers.

title: Skateboarding Twins Execute a Career 180 in Turning to Tennis
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz.  Nic and Tristan Puehse spent six years sailing through the air with the greatest of ease, bending on their skateboards like yogis on mats. They had a clothing contract with Nike before their eighth birthdays, and by the age of 12, they were performing difficult feats like the stalefish.

title: Reinventing Rio de Janeiro
description: With the World Cup and the Olympics bearing down on Rio within the next three years, officials here are struggling to reinvent this onetime third-world city with a first-world economy.

title: A Divided Rio de Janeiro, Overreaching for the World
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The bumpy ride in the rickety van heads up the steep hill into Morro da Providncia, this citys oldest favela. Last stop: a small, silent square with a hardware shop, bar and pair of young policemen in armored gear toting machine guns, patrolling the still-unopened cable-car station that the city has recently built. The port spreads out below.

title: Nickss Absence Against the Cowboys Adds to His Perplexing Season
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Hakeem Nicks, struggling through a middling, enigmatic season, spent all of last week insisting he was going to play against the Dallas Cowboys on Sunday. On game day, the Giants not only kept him out of uniform, they did not even let him warm up in the hours before kickoff to see if he could play.

title: As Homeless Line Up for Food, Los Angeles Weighs Restrictions
description: LOS ANGELES  They began showing up at dusk last week, wandering the streets, slumped in wheelchairs and sitting on sidewalks, paper plates perched on their knees. By 6:30 p.m., more than 100 homeless people had lined up at a barren corner in Hollywood, drawn by free meals handed out from the back of a truck every night by volunteers.

title: U.S. and Saudis in Growing Rift as Power Shifts
description: WASHINGTON  There was a time when Saudi and American interests in the Middle East seemed so aligned that the cigar-smoking former Saudi ambassador, Prince Bandar bin Sultan, was viewed as one of the most influential diplomats in Washington.

title: Dispute Erupts in India Over Surveillance by Candidate
description: NEW DELHI  In a set of telephone transcripts and recordings that were published by an Indian website this month, high-ranking intelligence and security officers from the western state of Gujarat can be heard reporting back on an unusual assignment: covertly tracing every movement of a young woman, meticulously documenting her contacts with men. Their findings were passed to another high-ranking official they referred to as Saheb.

title: Corrections: November 26, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: One-Trick Pony Offense Nags Jets
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  There was a splash of good news that came out of Sundays mauling in Baltimore, Rex Ryan said.

title: James Rensenbrink, 81, Dies; Founded Aquarian Weekly
description: When James Rensenbrink started an alternative newspaper in 1969, its mission  speaking truth to power, debunking corporate journalism, promoting rock n roll, publishing sex tips and drug advice that no mainstream newspaper would  made it like a thousand other alternative papers in that high-water-mark counterculture year.

title: Popping the Question, Tuhao-Style
description: How many pairs of shoes does it take to reach a Chinese girls heart? According to Xu Pengjie, a 28-year-old restaurant owner in Chengdu, the answer is 1,001.

title: The Changing American Family
description: American households have never been more diverse, more surprising, more baffling. In this special issue of Science Times, NATALIE ANGIER takes stock of our changing definition of family.

title: Franco and ODowd Confirmed for Of Mice and Men on Broadway
description: James Franco (127 Hours) and Chris ODowd (Bridesmaids) will make their Broadway debuts as George and Lennie in John Steinbecks play Of Mice and Men, with performances starting March 19 at the Longacre Theater, the lead producer, David Binder, announced Monday. The two stars had been in negotiations with Mr. Binder for the last few months, and he has also lined up one of the few Broadway theaters still available for the spring season.

title: Effective Corporate Tax Rates
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: Word of the Day | aversion
description: aversion \-vr-zhn, -shn\ noun

title: Lakers Finalize Deal With Bryant With Eye on 2014 Free Agents
description: Kobe Bryant and the Los Angeles Lakers finalized a two-year contract extension Monday that all but ensures Bryant will end his career with the team.

title: Typhoon Haiyan Through the Lens of Chinas 2008 Quake
description: Around the time I visited my second mass grave for victims of Typhoon Haiyan, I concluded this disaster was different. I had covered a catastrophic natural disaster before, the 2008 earthquake in Chinas Sichuan Province that left nearly 90,000 dead or missing.

title: Super Bowl First: A U.S. Telecast With Spanish Announcers
description: On Feb. 2, when Fox Sports carries Super Bowl XLVIII from MetLife Stadium, so will Fox Deportes, the Spanish-language network that is also part of 21st Century Fox. The Super Bowl has never before been televised in Spanish in the United States.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 8 P.M. (FX) WANTED (2008) A meek cubicle drone (James McAvoy, above) is initiated into a secret society of assassins known as the Fraternity to avenge the murder of his father in this ultraviolent action-thriller directed by Timur Bekmambetov. Morgan Freeman plays the organizations leader, and Angelina Jolie portrays an amoral if fashionably turned-out killer. Mr. Bekmambetov, a Russian filmmaker who has earned a cult following with his razzly-dazzly thrillers Day Watch and Night Watch, certainly proves here that he knows how to use every blunt tool of the bullying trade: flashy effects, zippy cuts, simulated death, walls of sound, wheels of steel and, in between the bullets and blood, a hot mama to make the brother-to-brother, man-on-man action less worrisome, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. Wanted is a goof, then, and for a short stretch a pretty diverting one.

title: Knicks Drop Sixth Straight, Falling in Portland
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  Before Monday nights game, one of the television sets inside the visitors locker room at the Moda Center was tuned to an N.F.L. game. This did not please Amare Stoudemire, the veteran Knicks forward who was sprawled on the floor studying film of the Trail Blazers. He wanted the football turned off. Why was it even on?

title: A Conversation With: Prabhat Jauhari, C.E.O. of Mumbai Private Security Firm
description: Prabhat Jauhari is the chief executive officer of Tops Air Rescue and Topsline Life Response Services, the first private emergency response service in Mumbai, which was started by Topsgrup in 2004. The Topsline crew, which is trained in rescue and evacuation operations, worked with the Mumbai police during the terror attacks of Nov. 26, 2008, to rescue over 150 people.

title: Qualcomm Investigated Under Antitrust Law
description: Qualcomm, the San Diego-based mobile chip maker, has become the target of an antitrust investigation led by the National Development and Reform Commission, Chinas top economic planning body  a disclosure that sent Qualcomm shares tumbling 1.5 percent and raised concerns about the companys prospects in its fastest-growing market.

title: News Quiz | November 26, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Test Yourself | History, Nov. 26, 2013
description: Take the Quiz

title: Bayer in Bid to Acquire Norwegian Cancer Drug Firm
description: LONDON  The Norwegian cancer drug maker Algeta said on Tuesday that it had received a preliminary offer to be acquired by the German drug giant Bayer for about $2.4 billion.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Whales, Sea Lions and Dolphins Congregate for Anchovy Feast
description: In With Extra Anchovies, Deluxe Whale Watching, Erica Goode reports on a rare convocation of sea life off the California coast.

title: Ukraine in Turmoil After Leaders Reject Major E.U. Deal
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Yuri V. Lutsenko, a onetime field commander of Ukraines 2004 Orange Revolution, looked out across the tens of thousands of people who gathered on Sunday to protest the governments decision to back away from a far-reaching political and trade deal with the European Union. Standing onstage under an ash-streaked sky, Mr. Lutsenko felt a powerful sense of dj vu  and a deep need to apologize.

title: Scots Propose Independence With Pounds and Passports
description: LONDON  Behind in the opinion polls, Scottish Nationalists who are seeking independence from Britain in a referendum next year set out their wish list for a new nation on Tuesday, but made several assertions about their future relations with Britain and international partners that are sharply disputed.

title: Mind the Gap
description: At the not-yet-completed One57, a luxury residential tower off Central Park, the unsold floor-through apartments are going for $53 million and up. The penthouse sold for more than $90 million. One57 will be the tallest residence in the Western Hemisphere (until another luxury high-rise on Park Avenue is completed in 2015), and on a clear day, residents on the top floors should be able to just make out the South Bronx.

title: The Final Frontier, in Photographs
description: There it is  the whole shebang. Or whats left of the Big Bang, if you want to be precise and scientific about it. The trippy scene, all fall colors and gray splotches, was built from data captured by NASAs Spitzer Space Telescope and puts in visual form the remaining background light from when the universe was less than one billion years old.

title: Do We Need Art in Our Lives?
description: Do we need art in our lives? Should viewing art be part of every childs education? Does it make us smarter or expose us to new ways of seeing the world?

title: A New Way to Report Fraud
description: The letters arrive almost daily, on official-looking letterhead from a supposed charity, or from the J.M.D. Major Cash Disbursement Office. More blatantly, letters sometimes come from an outfit called Mountains of Money. They announce that the 85-year-old man to whom theyre addressed has won a prize  the amount seems to hover around $11,000  and explain that to claim it, he has to fill out a form, often complete with a verification code, and send it in with a check for $6 or $7.

title: China to Send Jade Rabbit Rover to the Moon
description: China will send an unmanned rover to the moon in early December, a spokesman for the Commission of Science, Technology, and Industry for National Defense said on Tuesday. The lunar probe will be called the Yutu, or Jade Rabbit, a name that comes from a Chinese myth about a white rabbit that lives on the moon and was selected in an online poll.

title: Demonstrations in Bangkok Raise Concerns About Stability of Thailand
description: BANGKOK  Thailands governing party accused protesters on Tuesday of fomenting anarchy and trying to overthrow the government after thousands of people swarmed the streets of Bangkok, besieging crucial ministries and threatening to take their campaign nationwide.

title: Times Minute: Nov. 26 at 6 a.m.
description: Saudi Arabia on the Iran deal; Rio de Janeiro prepares to meet the world; and the science of modern families.

title: A New University Offers Liberal Arts as Higher Education Alternative
description: NEW DELHI  For decades, Indias institutes of technology and management, the famed I.I.T.s and I.I.M.s, have been seen as the pinnacle of this countrys higher education, offering world-class courses and above all, employability to its graduates.

title: The New York Times Minute
description: In the Video

title: Nuclear Accord Is Reached with Iran
description: But U.S. relations with Saudi Arabia and Israel are shaken.

title: New York Today: Holiday Weather Alert
description: Updated 12:24 p.m.

title: A Start-Up Tries to Solve the Gift Card Problem
description: Start-Up: Jifiti.

title: Intersection: Less Is More in Austin
description: In the South Congress neighborhood of Austin, Tex., the heat keeps the local style casual and comfortable.

title: Health Group Retracts Report on H.I.V. in Greece
description: LONDON  It took a while for people to notice, but once they did, the news spread like wildfire: The World Health Organization had said that about half of new H.I.V. cases in Greece were self-inflicted as a way to get state benefits.

title: Noted Philosopher Moves to N.Y.U.  and Beyond
description: The philosopher Kwame Anthony Appiah, known for his wide-ranging and accessible writings on cosmopolitanism, identity and global ethics, will be leaving Princeton for New York University at the end of the year.

title: In Performance: Jon DeVries and Maryann Plunkett of Regular Singing
description: The works in Richard Nelsons four-part Apple Family Plays are each set on a specific day in recent American history: election days of 2010 (That Hopey Changey Thing) and 2012 (Sorry); the 10th anniversary of 9/11 (Sweet and Sad) and the 50th anniversary of the assassination of President John F. Kennedy (Regular Singing). In this scene from Regular Singing, Barbara, a schoolteacher (played by Maryann Plunkett), and her uncle, Benjamin, a retired actor dealing with memory loss (portrayed by Jon DeVries), discuss an article about the assassination in The New York Times. Scenes from the four plays, which are being performed in repertory at the Public Theater through Dec. 15, are in this In Performance video player.

title: Tricky Little Things
description: Tiny as they are, misplaced commas form an outsize blot on a sentence. In the spectrum of grammatical lapses, they seem particularly amateurish.

title: Dolf van den Brink of Heineken USA, on Transparency
description: This interview with Dolf van den Brink, president and chief executive of Heineken USA, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Behind the Scenes of The Movies Issue
description: Last week, we teased the 2013 Movies Issue with a 15-second Instagram video. This time, we arent teasing. You can watch all 11 original films that Janusz Kaminski created for the magazine, each of which contains a line of dialogue written by one (or a team) of the best screenwriters of the year. Watch how it all came together in the video shown here, and get more backstage insight from this slide show.

title: Parents Receive Life Sentences in Murders of Daughter and Domestic Worker
description: NEW DELHI  Rajesh and Nupur Talwar were sentenced to life in prison on Tuesday by a special Central Bureau of Investigation court in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh, for the murders of their teenage daughter and a domestic worker.

title: Activist Funds and Board Influence
description: As activist hedge funds continue to get more of their preferred candidates on the boards of companies, some of the hedge funds are angling for certain directors to be paid twice: once by the company, and once by the hedge funds that supported their candidacy, DealBooks David Gelles reports.

title: Beautiful Fall, Apathetic Boyfriend
description: Dear Diary,

title: Bad Weather Arrives in Time for Thanksgiving Travel
description: One of the busiest travel days of the year is going to be messy for the East Coast.

title: Once Suitor, Jos. A. Bank Is a Target for Mens Wearhouse
description: Updated, 8:20 p.m. | Mens Wearhouse didnt like the feeling of being up for sale.

title: Argentina Is Said to Be Near Deal on Repsol Compensation
description: LONDON  Argentina and Repsol, the Spanish energy company, appear to be nearing a deal on compensation for the governments seizure of Repsols stake in an Argentine oil producer in 2012.

title: Carlyle to Buy Investor in Hedge Funds
description: The Carlyle Group said on Tuesday that it would acquire the Diversified Global Asset Management Corporation, an independent hedge fund manager, the latest push by Carlyle into areas beyond its core leveraged-buyout business.

title: Acrostic
description: Acrostic puzzle for December 1, 2013

title: Acrostic Answer
description: Acrostic answer for December 1, 2013

title: Musings on Minnesota Macro
description: Miles Kimball and Noah Smith have a long piece on the shakeup at the Minneapolis Fed, where a couple of prominent freshwater macro people have been fired. Kimball and Smith carefully tiptoe about exactly what happened, and so will I  I hear stuff, but its second- or third-order hearsay, and not reliable.

title: Bain to Sell Insurance Software Company
description: Applied Systems, a software company that focuses on the insurance industry, said on Tuesday that it had agreed to be acquired by the private equity firm Hellman & Friedman in a deal valued at $1.8 billion.

title: Daily Report: N.S.A. May Have Tapped Internet Cable Links
description: The recent revelation that the National Security Agency was able to eavesdrop on the communications of Google and Yahoo users without breaking into either companies data centers sounded like something pulled from a Robert Ludlum spy thriller. How on earth, the companies asked, did the N.S.A. get their data without them knowing about it?

title: Pakistan Breaks Ground on Nuclear Plant Project With China
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif on Tuesday ceremonially broke ground on a $9.59 billion nuclear power complex to be built in Karachi with Chinas help, seeking to ease Pakistans long-running energy crisis and signaling a new step by China in becoming a top nuclear supplier.

title: France Adds Troops in Central African Republic
description: In a bid to stem deepening chaos in the Central African Republic, where brutal government-affiliated militia groups have been pillaging and burning villages, the French defense minister announced on Tuesday that France would increase its deployment of troops there to about 1,000.

title: California Myths
description: Among the many vituperative reactions I had to yesterdays column, one recurred a lot  namely, the assertion that Californias rising enrollment in Obamacare would bankrupt the state, which is already a fiscal basket case.

title: Fifty Years Later, Why Does Eichmann in Jerusalem Remain Contentious?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on pressing and provocative questions about the world of books. This week, Adam Kirsch and Rivka Galchen on why Hannah Arendts Eichmann in Jerusalem remains contentious fifty years after it was first published.

title: Holiday | The Daily Gift: Alexander Wang Coasters
description: Every day from now until Christmas, the editors of T are sharing their personal gift suggestions.

title: Image of the Day: November 26
The Man Behind the MRAP Moves On
description: WASHINGTON  Amid the awards and decorations on display in the Pentagon office of Ashton B. Carter, the departing deputy secretary of defense, is a metal bearing, larger than a golf ball, which wears the scars of battle.

title: Another Turnaround by Arians, This Time in Arizona
description: Bruce Arians is doing it again. A year ago, he helped turn the Indianapolis Colts from the worst team in the N.F.L. to a playoff team. Hired as the teams offensive coordinator, he was named the Associated Press coach of the year after Chuck Pagano, who was found to have leukemia, took a leave of absence. The Arizona Cardinals hired Arians as their head coach after firing Ken Whisenhunt, and Arians is again a viable candidate for the award.

title: What I Needed to Understand About Health Insurance
description: I have bought health insurance for my workers since 1994, and since then Ive spent well over a million dollars paying premiums. I have always found it to be troubling that I was given sole authority to make the choice as to what kind of coverage we would offer, and to a certain extent, how much it would cost. Was I doing a good job? I never heard any complaints about the policies I chose, even when I moved us into an HMO in the late 90s, when I made my workers contribute to their plan costs in 2005, and when rates skyrocketed in the years after that.

title: To Help Typhoon Survivors, Go Local
description: Two years ago I watched the footage of the earthquake and tsunami in Japan, willing myself not to start imagining what else was going on that I couldnt see or read about. As a Japanese national living in the States, I was struck by the well-meaning experts who discouraged the public from donating to the relief efforts. Journalists questioned the logic of individuals giving to a wealthy country like Japan, and philanthropic advisors encouraged donors to give to organizations that could redirect funds to other more pressing needs outside of Japan after the initial relief effort. It was understandable, perhapsthe fog of disaster makes it hard to immediately know how much is needed, or what help is needed, even where.

title: New Jerseys Mutinous 33rd
description: John Toffey was sick with fever. The Union lieutenant had been ill for days and not able to attend to his duties. An Army surgeon in Chattanooga, Tenn., examined the 19-year-old officer on the evening of Nov. 22, 1863, and handed him a permit to go into the hospital.

title: In Our Pages: November 27
description: 1913: Oil Town Told to Surrender

title: Pope Sets Down Goals for an Inclusive Church, Reaching Out on the Streets
description: In his first nine months as leader of one billion Roman Catholics, Pope Francis has parceled out glimpses of his vision for remaking the church  in homilies and news conferences, interviews and offhand remarks to visitors.

title: A Fresh Look at Americas Gas Lands
description: Ive been meaning to post for awhile on Gas Rush Stories, a series of simple, but captivating short films on Americas gas drilling boom made by Kirsi Jansa, a Finnish video journalist currently living in Pittsburgh.

title: American Family Redefined
description: If the Burnses (with a family of 4 children from three earlier marriages) seem atypical as an American nuclear family, how about the Schulte-Waysers, a merry band of two married dads, six kids and two dogs? Or the Indrakrishnans, a successful immigrant couple in Atlanta whose teenage daughter divides her time between prosaic homework and the precision footwork of ancient Hindu dance; the Glusacs of Los Angeles, with their two nearly grown children and their litany of middle-class challenges that seem like minor sagas; Ana Perez and Julian Hill of Harlem, unmarried and just getting by, but with Warren Buffett-size dreams for their three young children; and the alarming number of families with incarcerated parents, a sorry byproduct of Americas status as the worlds leading jailer. Read more in The Changing American Family in Science Times.

title: At Least 30 Haitians Die After Boat Capsizes
description: MIAMI  At least 30 Haitians who tried to sail to the United States were found drowned on Tuesday after their overloaded boat ran aground off the Bahamas and capsized, several days after fishermen tipped off Bahamian military authorities about the vessel.

title: Pat McKillen, the Newest to Relive Bob Dylans Like a Rolling Stone
description: Val Haller, a music-obsessed baby boomer and the founder of the website Valslist.com, matches tracks from her generation to those of her 20-something sons generation.

title: A Well-Aged White Wine to Cosset Miso-Glazed Fish
description: This is a dish rich in umami, and you need a wine that wont wilt before it, preferably on the savory rather than fruity side. The ideal choice would be a well-aged white, like a 15-year-old grand cru Chablis, with just the right amount of richness and minerality to cosset the fish. Other options include a white Bordeaux from Pessac-Lognan or an older dry riesling with amplitude.

title: Take-Two Interactive Buys Back Icahn Stake
description: Take-Two Interactive Software announced on Tuesday that it had bought back the stake held by Carl C. Icahn, compelling the resignations of three board members he was allowed to appoint.

title: Rodriguez Amends Suit, Adding Claims About Selig
description: Alex Rodriguezs lawyers updated their lawsuit against Major League Baseball on Tuesday, adding new claims about the conduct of baseballs commissioner, Bud Selig, in defending his 211-game suspension of Rodriguez, the Yankees third baseman.

title: Feeling For | A Parisian-Style Retreat in the Heart of Greenwich Village
description: The Marlton House, built in 1900 and later a haven for Jack Kerouac and his crew, reopened this fall as the Marlton, a Parisian-inspired 107-room boutique hotel in the heart of Greenwich Village, just off Washington Square Park. It offers the same cool, casual elegance as the Bowery Hotel, a few blocks across town, but at a fraction of the price. The similarities to the Bowery are no surprise, as the Marlton is the work of the hotelier Sean MacPherson (also a developer of the Maritime and the Jane), who has once again created a hotel that feels as if it wasnt designed just to sleep but also to sidle up to the bar in a dignified way and watch the P.Y.T.s come and go. Its the kind of place you could easily visit for afternoon tea with a parent on one of the plush sofas, or rendezvous with your lover for a martini followed by a trip to one of the small yet charming rooms, where the bed is the main attraction and finishing details are not overlooked. If youre not in the mood for libations  and with creations like the Marvelous Sour (recipe below), the Marlton has taken steps to make sure that never happens  there is an espresso bar in the lobby that makes raw almond cappuccinos and gluten-free, vegan breakfast cookies. Coming soon will be a 98-seat restaurant in the rear of the lobby, Caf Marlton, which will serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. As a longtime neighbor of the building the Marlton now occupies, I can safely say its the best recent addition to the neighborhood where charm reigns supreme.

title: Times Minute: Nov. 26 at Noon
description: Severe weather threatens Thanksgiving travel; protests in Thailand; and moms market health care.

title: The New York Times Minute
description: In the Video

title: Battling Flames in Forests, With Prison as the Firehouse
description: PRESCOTT, Ariz.  The men cluster in a tight pack, identities obscured by fire-resistant Nomex clothes, each one anonymous except for the color of his helmet: red for corrections officers, blue and yellow for inmates.

title: Most New York Voters Happy With Cuomo, Poll Finds
description: With no declared Republican candidate, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is approaching his re-election year with an enviable approval rating and a comfortable advantage against one potential opponent, according to a poll released on Tuesday.

title: A $100 Weekend in Santiago, Chile
description: My sofa is very comfortable, boasted Marcos, the pony-tailed, Iron Maiden-loving Chilean who had met me at the centrally located Parque OHiggins metro stop in the Chilean capital of Santiago and was walking me to his place. I sometimes sleep on it myself. When you have just $100 to spend all weekend, any place will do  but his worn-in black leather sofa, paired with a thick comforter for warmth and a snow-white cat named Ixi (named for Itchy, the Simpsons cartoon mouse) for company, turned out to be a dream.

title: Barnes & Noble Reports Profit, but Sales Decline 8%
description: Barnes & Noble reported tepid sales in its bookstore and digital divisions for its most recent quarter, reflecting an overall weak publishing climate and flattening demand for e-books.

title: Chico Hamilton, Drummer, Bandleader and Exponent of Cool Jazz, Dies at 92
description: Chico Hamilton, a drummer and bandleader who helped put California on the modern-jazz map in the 1950s and remained active into the 21st century, died on Monday in Manhattan. He was 92.

title: Justices to Hear Contraception Cases Challenging Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to hear a pair of cases on whether corporations may refuse to provide insurance coverage for contraception to their workers based on the religious beliefs of the corporations owners.

title: U.S. Sends Two B-52 Bombers Into Air Zone Claimed by China
description: WASHINGTON  Defying China, two long-range American bombers flew through contested airspace over the East China Sea, days after the Chinese announced they were claiming the right to police the sky above a vast area that includes islands at the center of a simmering dispute with Japan.

title: Down the Instagram Rabbit Hole
description: Stacey Baker, magazine photo editor and Instagram dynamo, has been getting so much attention for her portraits of womens legs that she gets approached byfans offline. One time a tourist spotted her taking a legs shot and asked, Are you @stace_a_lace? The woman had worn special tights that day on her visit to New York hoping to be photographed.

title: From the Beatles to Lorde, Musicians Offer Songs for Philippine Relief Album
description: More than three dozen musicians representing a broad range of pop styles  from the Beatles, Bob Dylan, U2 and Earth, Wind and Fire, at the classic end, to Lorde, Beyonc, Justin Bieber and Katy Perry, among more recent hit makers  have contributed recordings to Songs for the Philippines, a 39-track compilation assembled to raise money for relief efforts in the country, which was devastated by Typhoon Haiyan on Nov. 8.

title: Words of Love, Pain, Protest and Motown
description: Zora Neale Hurston (1891-1960) was probably the first great African-American food writer. She regularly hauled her appetites into her prose.

title: Brazil Is Entranced by a Tale of Love, Taxes and Bribery
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  There were the boxes of Cuban cigars, which cost about $500 each at a shop in Vila Nova Conceio, one of the most exclusive districts of So Paulo, and the $2,260 bottles of Vega Sicilia nico, a legendary Spanish red. Throw in a Porsche Cayenne, speedboat jaunts to tropical islands and all-night soirees with high-end escorts, and what do you get?

title: Taking a Break From I.V.F.
description: Its all downhill from here.

title: Now Screening | Brought to You by Kenneth Cole, an Inside Perspective on the Battle Against AIDS
description: There is this pervasive sense out there that we have solved AIDS and that its not a crisis anymore, says the designer Kenneth Cole, who is also chairman of the board of AmfAR, the Foundation for AIDS Research. But AIDS is alive as it ever was. There are people living their lives recklessly and irresponsibly, and people need to understand that AIDS is still devastating, absent of a cure.

title: The Popes Take on Capitalism
description: From the moment of his election, there have been signs that Pope Francis was going to be a very different sort of pontiff. It started with his decision to live in modest quarters instead of the palatial papal apartments, and continued with his tolerant comments about homosexuality and his complaint that the Roman Catholic Church had an unhealthy obsession with issues like abortion.

title: Mens Wearhouse Dusts Off the Pac-Man Defense
description: Deal aficionados have a Thanksgiving present. Mens Wearhouse has turned the tables on Jos. A. Bank Clothiers, offering to acquire the company, which had previously bid to acquire Mens Wearhouse. What fun!

title: Childrens Tablet Teaches Reading, Writing and Texting
description: Children, being the curious little monkeys they are, are keen to mimic their parents, but some activities, like texting, run the risk of exposing children to potential harm. Fear not, worried parents: VTech has created a safe zone for texting with its latest learning tablet, the InnoTab 3S.

title: Tough Week at the Broadway Box Office
description: The new Broadway musical A Gentlemans Guide to Love and Murder opened last week to some of the best reviews of the fall, but now comes the hard part: increasing its ticket sales.

title: Lou Brissie, an All-Star and War Hero, Dies at 89
description: Lou Brissie, who suffered devastating leg wounds in World War II but went on to become an All-Star pitcher with the Philadelphia Athletics and a symbol of perseverance for the disabled, died on Monday in Augusta, Ga. He was 89.

title: Ford Discloses Two New Recalls for the 2013 Escape
description: Ford is recalling about 140,000 of its 2013 Escape crossovers in the United States because of a problem with the 1.6-liter EcoBoost 4-cylinder engine that has caused 13 fires, the automaker has told the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, according to a report from the automaker posted Tuesday on the safety agencys website.

title: LED Lights, and an App to Control Them
description: The price of long-lasting LED bulbs is dropping rapidly  they are usually under $10, and they last many, many times as long as regular incandescent bulbs while using far less electricity.

title: A D.J. Booth in Your Pocket
description: Monster has found a way to shrink the D.J. booth into a pocket-size device. The company, known for its audio cables and headphones, this month introduced the GO-DJ, a portable turntable and mixer.

title: Restaurant Report: Esquina Mocot in So Paulo
description: Mocot, Jos Oliveira de Almeidas restaurant in the Vila Medeiros neighborhood of So Paulo, opened in 1974. Over the past decade, his son, Rodrigo Oliveira, has transformed the unassuming neighborhood restaurant and bar into one of the most famous in the country, making him one of the most recognizable faces in Brazilian cuisine. For years he has fought off offers to open another restaurant in the citys wealthier southern districts. Instead, he opened Esquina Mocot in May, right next door.

title: New Draws for Diners in a Sonoma County Town
description: Forty miles north of San Francisco, Petaluma has had a long and storied past as a prolific Sonoma County farm town  in 1907, it was known as a City of a Million Hens, turning out more than 120 million eggs that year (it was where the egg incubator was invented). To this day, it yields a cornucopia of food for top Bay Area restaurants from lauded producers like Cowgirl Creamery, Lagunitas Brewing Company and Liberty Ducks. But with several restaurant openings in recent years, Petaluma itself has lately been elevated to a culinary destination worthy of a visit.

title: Prominent Egyptian Activists Detained for Protesting Under New Law
description: Updated, 5:57 p.m. | Using new powers to stifle dissent granted this week by Egypts military-backed government, riot police officers dispersed a peaceful protest outside the Parliament in Cairo on Tuesday and detained several prominent activists.

title: Aerolineas Argentinas to Restore Flights to J.F.K.
description: As many international airlines expanded to take advantage of Argentinas post-peso crisis tourist boom, the countrys own national airline, Aerolineas Argentinas, seemed to go in reverse, even discontinuing its flight between New Yorks Kennedy International Airport and Buenos Aires Ezeiza airports in 2008.

title: In Silicon Valley, Partying Like Its 1999 Once More
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  These are fabulous times in Silicon Valley.

title: Ask Well: Nighttime Urination
description: Question:

title: Leave of Absence for Lara Logan After Flawed Benghazi Report
description: The CBS News correspondent Lara Logan and her producer, Max McClellan, made serious errors in an Oct. 27 report on the attack on the American compound in Benghazi, Libya, and will take leaves of absence, the network announced on Tuesday. Four Americans died in the Sept. 11, 2012, attack, including Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens.

title: The Obamacare Worm Turns
description: Image taken down by request

title: In a Time of Need, the Vice President Plays to His Strengths
description: WASHINGTON  Speaking to longshoremen, local politicians and health care activists last week in Houston, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. variously quoted his grandfather Ambrose Finnegan, his father, Joe Sr., and the poet William Butler Yeats. Joey, he recalled his grandfather hollering, keep the faith!

title: Making San Francisco Accessible to More Than the Tech Elite
description: San Francisco is having an identity crisis. As we wrote about in a front-page articlethat appeared Monday, the prospering of tech companies has been accompanied by evictions, rising prices and growing resentment.

title: Inquiry of JPMorgans Asia Hiring
description: Federal investigators and Hong Kong and British authorities are examining JPMorgan Chases hiring practices in Asia. The case began as an inquiry into the banks hiring of the sons and daughters of Chinas elite.

title: 16 Recipes for Thanksgiving Leftovers
description: Chances are youll have a helping (or four) of leftovers after the feast. Here we offer a few suggestions for recipes to put that extra turkey, cranberry sauce and squash to good use.

title: All the Way, With Bryan Cranston, Sets Broadway Opening Date
description: The producers of All the Way, Robert Schenkkans play about Lyndon B. Johnsons tumultuous first year as president, are banking on the star power provided by Bryan Cranston in the lead role, announcing a Broadway opening date in a theater usually occupied by big-budget musicals.

title: Syrian Rebel Group Skeptical of Talks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A planned international peace conference aimed at ending the civil war in Syria faced its first hurdles on Tuesday, as the head of the main opposition coalition said the group had not yet decided whether it would attend and the leader of the groups military arm said his forces would keep fighting regardless.

title: Alec Baldwins Show on MSNBC Is Canceled
description: The actor Alec Baldwins short-lived show on MSNBC has been terminated, less than two weeks after he was suspended for making a gay slur in a confrontation with a photographer seeking to get pictures of him with his wife and baby.

title: An Article About New Yorkers Who Go Hungry Signals a New Focus on Inequality
description: At a time of year when many are preparing to eat until bursting, its especially sobering to read the article in Tuesdays Times about the number of New Yorkers who go hungry on a regular basis  one in five children throughout the city and nearly half the children in the Bronx.

title: An Unimaginable Milestone for an American Hostage in Iran
description: In the wake of its diplomatic success over Irans nuclear program, the Obama administration on Tuesday urged Iranian officials to help secure the release of a former F.B.I. agent who went missing in 2007 in Iran.

title: The Gun Report: November 26, 2013
description: Adam Lanza, the Newtown gunman, covered the windows in his room with black garbage bags. He changed his clothes multiple times a day and refused to eat unless his food was arranged in a special way on his plate. Though his bedroom was on the same floor as his mothers in their Connecticut home, he only communicated with her by email, and he barred her from entering his room. He collected news clips about mass killings, including a couple from this newspaper. The only time he did bond with anyone else was when his mother took him shooting.

title: 12 Years a Slave and Nebraska  Lead Indie Spirit Awards
description: The Film Independent Spirit Awards, which typically highlight non-blockbuster cinema, announced nominees on Tuesday. As usual, they include many films that are also on the path to the Academy Awards. The hopefuls for best feature include 12 Years a Slave, All Is Lost, Nebraska, Inside Llewyn Davis and Frances Ha.

title: Market Report
description: Victorian style is back, streamlined and laced with military references.

title: A More Sensible Suit Deal
description: Turning a suit deal inside out has revealed a silver lining. After fending off a hostile bid from Jos. A. Bank Clothiers, Mens Wearhouse is now proposing to buy its smaller rival for $1.2 billion. The estimated cost savings could cover nearly the entire purchase price, and the combined company would be less indebted. Structured this way, the transaction is more sensible.

title: A School Where Cooks Learn to Be Farmers, a Project for White Corn and More
description: To Harvest: A Schools Big Crop of Savings

title: Country Music Deal Pairs Clear Channel and CMT
description: With country music ascendant as one of the strongest genres in the music business, the radio giant Clear Channel Communications has announced a partnership with the country cable television channel CMT that will involve cross-promotion on the two companies various media platforms, and Clear Channel taking over the distribution of a popular CMT radio show.

title: The Simone Opens on the Upper East Side
description: Headliner

title: New Rules Would Rein In Nonprofits Political Role
description: The Obama administration on Tuesday moved to curb political activity by tax-exempt nonprofit organizations, with potentially major ramifications for some of the biggest and most secretive spenders in American politics.

title: Sanchez Says He Wants to Stay With Jets
description: MORRISTOWN, N.J.  Mark Sanchez predicted Tuesday that he would be better than ever when his football career resumed. And he insisted the Jets would reap the benefits.

title: Somtum Der
description: Inside the East Village Thai restaurant where papaya salad is made to order in eight variations.

title: Spice of Life? It Depends on the Variety
description: Many restaurants station an employee near the door who can make or break your evening. At Somtum Der in the East Village, that person is not a host who may banish you to a table in the frozen wastes of Siberia but a cook who can set your mouth on fire with the flavors of northeastern Thailand.

title: Printing From an Android Tablet
description: Android Tablet

title: Judge Orders Release of Sandy Hook 911 Recordings
description: A Connecticut judge ruled on Tuesday that the police must release recordings of the 911 calls made from Sandy Hook Elementary School during the shooting last year that left 20 children and six adults dead.

title: Good May Come on Heels of Bad and Ugly for Knicks and Nets
description: The N.B.A. season is still in its infancy, but it feels like ages ago when the Nets were celebrated for adding two potential Hall of Famers and the Knicks received at least a few pats on the back for acquiring a sweet-shooting 7-footer who was once a No. 1 overall pick.

title: Messi or Ronaldo?
description: After Cristiano Ronaldos third goal against Sweden in the World Cup qualifying playoffs in Stockholm, the camera panned the crowd. The Swedish fans had a look of despair. It wasnt even anger or frustration, simply pure despair. It was what I imagine the ancient Greeks looked like in myths when tragedy struck at the hands of the gods  pained, but resigned to the fact that the destruction was not the work of an Earthly power.

title: Florida Governor Calls for Congressman to Quit After Arrest
description: WASHINGTON  Gov. Rick Scott of Florida added his voice Tuesday to calls for Representative Trey Radel to resign from Congress after pleading guilty to cocaine-related charges here last week.

title: Westchester Square, the Bronx: Stay Awhile
description: Look past signs of the modern era in Westchester Square  cars zipping along the Hutchinson Parkway, No. 6 trains clattering on elevated tracks and traffic stalled on Westchester Avenue  and you can glimpse its origins as a Colonial-era village.

title: The Silent-Era Shostakovich
description: When prominent conductors visit New York for important engagements with local institutions, their schedules are usually very full. So it says good things about the priorities of the Russian maestro Vladimir Jurowski that while in New York to conduct a six-performance run of Strausss Die Frau Ohne Schatten at the Metropolitan Opera, he made time to work with the Juilliard Orchestra on an adventurous Shostakovich program. That concert took place on Monday at Alice Tully Hall, the night before Mr. Jurowskis final Frau at the Met. The hall was packed.

title: Ryan McNamara Wins Performa 13 Prize
description: Performa 13, the fifth iteration of New Yorks performance art biennial, concluded its three-week run on Sunday with a Grand Finale celebration during which the artist Ryan McNamara received the second Malcolm McLaren Award. Sponsored by the Vinyl Factory and accompanied by a $10,000 cash prize, the award was established in 2011 to honor the British artist, musician, clothing designer and impresario Malcolm McLaren, who died that year. According to a Performa statement, it is given to an artist who demonstrates the most innovative and thought-provoking performance during the biennial.

title: In Fashion | Four Young Designer Duos to Watch
description: A new wave of inventive fashion labels prove there is magic in collaboration.

title: Pictures of the Day: Afghanistan and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Egypt, Afghanistan, the Philippines and Japan.

title: Fantasy Football Week 13: Mining for Waiver Wire Gold
description: For most fantasy football owners, were a week from the beginning of the fantasy playoffs. With bye weeks finally over, the time for adding positional depth is over. Its time to worry about who will be starting, not what type of bench depth you might be able to use in a trade or during a bye week.

title: Hewlett-Packard Earnings Top Expectations, but Revenue Falls
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Hewlett-Packard reported stronger-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings on Tuesday, telling analysts it was making great strides from its woeful position of 26 months ago, when Meg Whitman took over as chief executive.

title: Online Help to Pick a Car and Make the Down Payment
description: When Lindsay Frandsen thought about registering for gifts for her wedding, she realized that what she and her husband really needed was a car.

title: In Beverly Hills, Suites Celebrate a Milestone
description: Five Beverly Hills luxury hotels have found a way to celebrate the citys 100th birthday in keeping with its legendary image.

title: New York Philharmonic Considering a New Concertmaster
description: Could the moribund Minnesota Orchestras loss become the New York Philharmonics gain?

title: W.H.O. Estimate of Swine Flu Deaths in 2009 Rises Sharply
description: About 203,000 people around the world died of flu and respiratory problems during the 2009 H1N1 swine flu pandemic, according to a new study funded by the World Health Organization.

title: Alfred Feld, Goldmans Longest-Serving Employee, Dies at 98
description: Alfred Feld, the longest-serving employee at Goldman Sachs, with more than 80 years of service at the Wall Street bank, died on Monday in Palm Beach, Fla. He was 98.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: 'Black Nativity'
description: Kasi Lemmons narrates a scene from her musical, featuring Jennifer Hudson and Jacob Latimore.

title: No Rain on Her Parade
description: Ann Hampton Callaway was in full command of her vocal powers at Sundays opening-night performance of her show Songs I Wish Id Written, at 54 Below. Those powers are so broad and meticulously cultivated that Ms. Callaway has sometimes succumbed to the understandable temptation to show off her technique like a peacock displaying its colors. For all the wonders of her fluting high notes and precisely rendered quasi-improvisatory jazz inventions, and her skill at instrumental imitation, such pyrotechnics are extras best held in reserve and released sparingly.

title: Breadlines Return
description: The Great Recession was the worst downturn since the Great Depression. And yet, throughout the recent decline and todays sluggish recovery, conditions have never seemed as bad as they were in the 1930s. Breadlines, for example, have not been commonplace.

title: An Evolution Makes Itself Quite Clear
description: Chemistry can be a fast process, but that seldom tends to be the case among musical ensembles, where the term also connotes the end result of that process: a state of grace formed among individuals bonded together as an aggregate. If at the start of a concert by the Juilliard String Quartet at Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night I was unsure that the vital transformation had occurred yet, by evenings end I was convinced that it had begun in earnest.

title: It Can Be Hard to Live Up to History
description: LONDON  Is Stuttgart the hub of ballet choreography in Continental Europe? There was cause to think so from reading the biographies of the nine choreographers featured last week in Made in Germany, a three-hour program of 13 works with which the Stuttgart Ballet opened its season here at Sadlers Wells.

title: Who Knew That Greek Festival Had Such Legs?
description: Terrence McNally plants a big kiss on his lifelong love  the theater  in his latest play, And Away We Go, a time-traveling romp set backstage during epochal moments in the history of drama over a couple of millenniums. As smooches go, this one is wet  which is to say lavishly affectionate  and sloppy, meaning overstuffed and halfway to haywire. Nevertheless, fellow adorers of theater will find much to divert them in Mr. McNallys frolicsome valentine to the glorious, maddening, demanding (insert your own clichd adjective here) world of footlights, spotlights and ghost lights.

title: Chance Encounter Goes Viral; Cyberbullying Is Next
description: Chen Kaige, who remains best known for directing the Cannes prizewinner Farewell My Concubine, shouldnt be faulted for attempting a state-of-the-nation look at China today with his new movie, Caught in the Web. But this story of cyberbullying and its discontents, though harboring flinty truths and staffed with popular domestic stars, is a messy collision of strained portrayals, semi-comic incidents and tear-jerking tactics.

title: Christmas in Harlem, and O Come, All Ye Songs
description: Sometimes it takes just one thing  a gesture, a look, the quality of light on a face  to fall for a movie. For me, that moment came in the musical Black Nativity, when several characters, including a young couple  Jo-Jo and his very pregnant companion, Maria (Luke James and Grace Gibson)  sing a sharply reworked Silent Night. They say this is your punishment for such poor judgment, Maria sings on a cold Harlem night. How you gonna feed it? That line slips by quickly, but with that two-letter word  it  the movie ferociously closes the gap between one homeless child born into poverty and all the forgotten rest.

title: A Pool Party Thats Also an Art Project
description: The British performance and installation artist Ed Fornieles loves to make a mess. In 2011, he sowed disorder on social media by using dozens of fake accounts to enact the Facebook meta-drama Dorm Daze. Earlier this year, for his exhibition Despicable Me 2, an ode to the fictional Gen Y goddess Britney Rivers, he cluttered Mihai Nicodim Gallery in Los Angeles with totems of modern-day adolescence, including glitter, hearts, confetti and snapshots. And most recently, for a benefit at the New Museum in New York, he wrought chaos by hiring outlandish performers to attend as guests and mingle with the paying attendees, satirizing the conventions of the charity gala.

title: The New York Times Minute
description: In the Video

title: In the End, Its Not About the Food
description: TORONTO  In Canada, where Im from, Thanksgiving is over already. We celebrated on your Columbus Day, and if it offers any solace as you grow increasingly (or maybe just a little bit) anxious in these final hours, ours turned out fine.

title: Times Minute: Nov. 26 at 6 p.m.
description: The Supreme Court will hear cases that test President Obamas health care law; the popes compassionate vision; and a special visitor.

title: From the Heat of Royal Passion, Poof! Its Permafrost
description: A beautiful princess with magical powers that she cant control; an adorable snowman, with buck teeth and a carrot for a nose, who longs to sunbathe because no one ever told him that heat melts ice; a picture-perfect prince who is revealed to be a scheming, opportunistic cad.

title: Risky Investment Vehicle With High Yields Gains Prominence
description: Congress and investors seem to love investment firms known as business development companies.

title: From a Bronx Apartments Oven, a Gingerbread Colossus Rises in Queens
description: To call it a village would seem to diminish its Lilliputian sprawl, seeing as how it encompasses 164 structures and weighs in at slightly more than 1.5 tons, including a stuporous 2,240 pounds of icing.

title: You Can Check Out Any Time You Like, but ...
description: The question that propels Oldboy, Spike Lees kinetic and colorful new movie, is Why? Why has somebody  for a long time, we dont know who  taken the trouble to kidnap Joe Doucett (Josh Brolin), an alcoholic advertising executive, and lock him up in a fake hotel room for 20 years? Why has Joe been framed for a murder and then, after making a mental journey to madness and back, set free?

title: Sicilian Art on the Do-Not-Travel List
description: A look at some of the important artworks that have been banned for travel by Sicilys regional government.

title: Citing Inequity, Sicily Bans Loans of 23 Artworks
description: Sicilys regional government has set a travel ban on 23 of the islands most important artworks, a decree that says such works, many of which were recently lent to museums in the United States and elsewhere, should not circulate abroad except under extraordinary circumstances.

title: Bassem Youssef on the Muslim Brotherhood
description: For Mr. Youssef, an Egyptian satirist whose television show was recently suspended, all of Egypt is paying the price for the Muslim Brotherhoods failure to rule and the subsequent military takeover.

title: Georges Lautner Dies at 87; Prolific French Film Director
description: Georges Lautner, a prolific French director who specialized in comedy and crime  often in the same movie  and became an audience favorite in his home country, died on Friday in Neuilly-sur-Seine, on the outskirts of Paris. He was 87.

title: S.E.C. Takes Aim at Swiss Company and Detroit Money Market Fund
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced a pair of enforcement actions on Tuesday, accusing a Swiss company of bribery and a Detroit money market fund of fraud.

title: Excerpts From a Talk With Bassem Youssef
description: For Mr. Youssef, a popular Egyptian satirist whose television show was recently suspended, his program is a mirror for developments in Egypt.

title: Where Film Marries Video Game
description: While filming a documentary about divisive oil refinery ventures in the subzero cold of Fort McMurray, Alberta, the director David Dufresne said he wasnt considering only pollution in that Canadian boomtown or the vast tar sands beneath its frozen ground. He was also thinking deeply about technology, about making a new kind of hybrid media, a docugame.

title: Bassem Youssef on Self-Censorship
description: For Mr. Youssef, an Egyptian satirist whose television show was recently suspended, self-censorship is an inevitable consequence of prevailing limits on free speech.

title: Bassem Youssef on Egypt in the News
description: For Mr. Youssef, a popular Egyptian satirist whose television show was recently suspended, the lesson learned is that no one can predict how events will unfold in Egypt.

title: Down in the Bayou, Mellow Theyre Not
description: Nothing says Thanksgiving like a beat-em-up written by Sylvester Stallone in which Jason Statham gets to knock the stuffing out of James Franco. If you think thats a spoiler, youve either never seen an audience-pandering movie or the poster for Homefront, which shows a snake-eyed Mr. Franco glowering, in what appears to be hell, under an image of the stern-looking Mr. Statham overlaid with an American flag and embracing a child. The movie is as blunt an instrument as the poster, but its also crammed with enough moving parts and unexpected distractions (Winona Ryder as a meth whore) to make it an indefensibly enjoyable piece of exploitation hackwork.

title: Malls Work on Their Security, but Keep It in the Background
description: As millions of Americans descend on the countrys shopping malls this week for the holiday shopping season, few may notice new security measures intended to prevent violence like the recent shooting at a mall in Paramus, N.J., that left a gunman dead and terrified thousands of shoppers.

title: Ras Marcus
description: Ras Marcus, an award-winning Calypsonian artist, singing Go Fuh Cup.

title: Bassem Youssef on Egypts Polarization
description: For Mr. Youssef, a popular Egyptian satirist whose television show was recently suspended, Egypt today is more polarized than ever.

title: Gary dos Santos, Mayor of Strawberry Fields, Dead at 49
description: Gary dos Santos, 49, a John Lennon devotee and a fixture in Strawberry Fields in Central Park, died Monday night at Mount Sinai Hospital in Manhattan from complications from leukemia, said his companion, Lisa Page.

title: City Erred in Putting Shelter Rules Into Effect, Court Rules
description: The Bloomberg administration violated city rules in trying to carry out a policy that imposes stricter requirements for sheltering homeless adults, New York States highest court ruled on Tuesday.

title: A Couple Living in a State of Nostalgia
description: Modern documentary filmmaking has been often defined by speed and portability. That was true in the late 50s and early 60s, when lightweight machinery helped give birth to the cinma vrit and direct cinema movements, and it is certainly true today, when smartphones and tiny digital cameras turn everyday life into a collective vrit project.

title: Thanksgiving Day Closings in the Region
Obama Message at DreamWorks: Hooray for Hollywood
description: GLENDALE, Calif.  President Obama tried to escape the controversy over the rocky rollout of his health care program by heading to Hollywood on Tuesday and focusing on one of the United States most thriving industries: entertainment.

title: Cardinals Put Aside Sentiment and Redesign a Perennial Contender
description: When the St. Louis Cardinals clinched their latest trip to the World Series last month at Busch Stadium, General Manager John Mozeliak told the crowd what made this pennant special.

title: Young Signed, but Mets Fans and Wright Are Still Waiting
description: David Wright, the Mets captain, made the rounds of radio interviews in recent days, letting it be known that after five straight losing seasons he was just as anxious as all those tortured Mets fans wondering what Sandy Alderson, the general manager, would do to improve the team.

title: From Hurricane Sandys Muck, Salvaged Bits of Staten Island Lives
description: One photo is a crackled black-and-white of a clean-shaven man in a dark uniform, smiling next to a woman in a curly brunette bob wearing what looks like nurse attire.

title: Voters in SeaTac, Wash., Back $15 Minimum Wage
description: SEATAC, Wash.  After weeks of ballot counting, elections officials said on Tuesday that voters in this small city south of Seattle had in fact approved by 77 votes the highest municipal minimum wage in the nation, $15 an hour, more than twice the federal minimum.

title: Much Ado About Bitcoin
description: FOR the obsessive followers of the volatile virtual currency bitcoin, the price of a single bitcoin at the time their fixation began holds undue significance. I know one bitcoin cost around $9 when I first stumbled on it in the summer of 2011. That was before I single-handedly sent the price of bitcoin soaring.

title: Jurors Deadlock in Harlem Police Officers Trial
description: A New York police officer who was charged with participating in a robbery crew that targeted drug dealers was convicted on Tuesday of two counts of obstruction of justice, but a mistrial was declared on the more serious robbery charges after the jury was unable to resolve its deadlock.

title: Venture Capital Investment Rises
description: Venture capital investment in the third quarter was up 17 percent from the same quarter last year.

title: Gynecologists May Treat Men, Board Says in Switch
description: A professional group that certifies obstetrician-gynecologists reversed an earlier directive and said on Tuesday that its members were permitted to treat male patients for sexually transmitted infections and to screen men for anal cancer.

title: A Bird Whose Life Depends on a Crab
description: GLOUCESTER, Mass.  HORSESHOE CRABS have been around for 475 million years, making them among earths oldest animals. They emerge from waters along the Eastern Seaboard during the high tides of full and new moons each May and June to spawn and lay their eggs on sandy beaches. The worlds largest population is concentrated in the Delaware Bay off the coasts of New Jersey and Delaware.

title: Comet Nears Sun, Offering Planetary Clues
description: A comet that spent the first 4.5 billion years of its existence in the farthest reaches of the solar system will almost graze the furnace of the sun on Thursday.

title: Searching for Motives in Mass Killings
description: To the Editor:

title: The Doctor Is Sick: He Will See You Now
Iran Nuclear Agreement
description: To the Editor:

title: Worried About Obamacare
description: To the Editor:

title: City Council Looks at Lower Speed Limits
description: A high-velocity, if perpetually congested, city is being told yet again to slow down.

title: What Japan Should Do
description: To the Editor:

title: The Politics of Ethanol
description: To the Editor:

title: I.M.F. Shifts Its Approach to Bailouts
description: WASHINGTON  The International Monetary Fund, convinced that Europe erred in forcing debtor countries like Greece and Portugal to bear nearly all the pain of recovery on their own, is pushing hard for a plan that would impose upfront losses on bondholders the next time a country in the euro area requests a bailout.

title: Judge Says Statements by Bin Ladens Son-in-Law Can Be Used in Terrorism Case
description: A federal judge in Manhattan declined on Tuesday to suppress statements made to the authorities by a son-in-law of Osama bin Laden who is charged with conspiring to kill Americans.

title: New Boom in Subprime Loans, for Smaller Businesses
description: A small, little-known company from Missouri borrows hundreds of millions of dollars from two of the biggest names in Wall Street finance. The loans are rated subprime. Whats more, they carry few of the standard protections seen in ordinary debt, making them particularly risky bets.
