title: Another Challenge to the Health Care Law
description: More than a year after it upheld the constitutionality of the Affordable Care Act, the Supreme Court has set the stage for a showdown over the laws requirement that employer health plans cover birth control. It agreed on Tuesday to hear two cases challenging the mandate, each brought by a secular, profit-making company seeking an exemption on religious grounds. They are among a slew of lawsuits seeking similar exemptions. Lower federal appellate courts have split on the question, creating a need for a decisive ruling from the Supreme Court that rejects the specious religious liberty claims.

title: N.F.L. Concussion Case Offers Clues for Hockey Lawsuit
description: When the N.F.L. agreed in August to pay $765 million to settle a lawsuit filed by thousands of retirees who said that the league had failed to disclose the dangers of repeated head trauma, it largely ended one legal challenge and invited others.

title: Escalating Debt
description: Ever since the recession hit in 2008, the debt burden of most European nations has risen sharply. Particularly vulnerable countries like Greece and Portugal have been forced to impose further austerity measures and turn to their neighbors and the International Monetary Fund for bailouts to help manage their finances.

title: The War on Thanksgiving
description: In 1939, Thanksgiving was supposed to fall on Nov. 30, but President Franklin Roosevelt, on the advice of the National Retail Dry Goods Association, pushed it forward a week to extend the holiday gift-buying season. That delighted business owners but upset traditionalists, like the selectmen of Plymouth, Mass., who felt that celebrating early meant sacrificing the real significance of the day for the purpose of satisfying commercial interests.

title: Sifting Through the Irish Troubles
description: Attorney General John Larkin of Northern Ireland has stirred passionate controversy with his suggestion that the passage of time makes it counterproductive to continue investigating the sectarian raids and military operations that took more than 3,500 lives during the Troubles, the violent conflict in Northern Ireland that lasted more than a generation.

title: Pressure and Passivity on Immigration
description: President Obama made the case for immigration reform again on Monday, in a speech in San Francisco that seemed mostly directed to Republicans in Congress, who arent listening.

title: U.S. Coast Guard Rescue Video
description: Dozens of Haitians sat on the hull of a sailboat after it grounded and capsized 15 nautical miles southwest of the Bahamas.

title: Home for the Holidays
New Jersey Now Allows Gambling via Internet
description: New Jersey began allowing Internet gambling on Tuesday in a much-watched bet that there are untapped sources of revenue on bedside iPads and cubicle desktops, and even among people checking their phones while they wait in line for coffee.

title: Toyo Tire Agrees to Penalty in Price-Fixing Conspiracy
description: A Japanese auto parts company agreed to pay a $120 million fine and plead guilty to charges that it fixed prices, becoming the latest supplier charged in the Justice Departments sweeping antitrust investigation of the auto parts business, the department said on Tuesday.

title: Enjoy the Parade, and Dont Forget to Thank Your Friendly Sewer Workers
description: By midmorning Tuesday, the sewer workers had taken apart five catch basins along Central Park West near the American Museum of Natural History. Then they scooped out street sludge that had been trapped in a kind of holding vault, where it had steeped for two or three years in about four feet of water.

title: Book Published in 1640 Sets a Record at Auction
description: It already held a record as the first book printed in English in North America. Now it holds two: It is also the most expensive book ever sold at auction.

title: Pigskin Pride and Prejudice
description: WASHINGTON  I dreamed of Peyton Manning.

title: Analyst Seeks to Avoid Jail by Testifying in SAC Trial
description: The star witness in the federal governments insider trading prosecution of Michael Steinberg, once a senior trader at SAC Capital Advisors, told a federal jury on Tuesday why he was cooperating with prosecutors and testifying at the trial.

title: Strong Winds May Ground Biggest Balloons at Thanksgiving Day Parade
description: The fate of the worlds most famous balloons is up in the air.

title: Clinton Seeks State Dept. Legacy Beyond That of Globe-Trotter
description: This month at a symposium at Georgetown University on Afghan women, Secretary of State John Kerry praised his predecessor, Hillary Rodham Clinton, whom he referred to as Madam Secretary-Senator-First-Lady-Everything.

title: With New Agreement, N.Y.U. Would Again Recognize Graduate Assistants Union
description: For eight years, hundreds of graduate students at New York University have been at war with the schools president, John Sexton, over his 2005 decision to stop recognizing the labor union that once represented more than 1,000 of the universitys graduate teaching and research assistants.

title: Clip: 'Get a Horse!'
description: A segment from the animated Mickey Mouse short.

title: New Birth Control Label Counters Lawsuit Claim
description: European health authorities have made two significant changes to the label of an emergency contraception pill that is equivalent to Plan B One-Step. One of the changes could be relevant to two cases that the Supreme Court added to its docket on Tuesday.

title: Pulling a More Diverse Group of Achievers Into the Advanced Placement Pool
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Every year, more than 600,000 academically promising high school students  most of them poor, Latino or black  fail to enroll in Advanced Placement courses, often viewed as head starts for the college-bound.

title: Merrell Williams Jr., Paralegal Who Bared Big Tobacco, Dies at 72
description: Merrell Williams Jr., a former paralegal who leaked mountains of internal documents of the Brown & Williamson Tobacco Company in 1994, fueling lawsuits that resulted in an industry payout of billions of dollars to pay smokers medical bills, died on Nov. 18 in Ocean Springs, Miss. He was 72.

title: Knicks Owner Is Singing the Blues, and So Is His Team
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Hello everybody! James L. Dolan shouted into the microphone in front of about 100 people who had arrived early at the Amway Center for an Eagles concert.

title: Resurrecting His Masters Mouse Voice
description: Starting with Steamboat Willie in 1928, Walt Disney provided the high-pitched, enthusiastic tones of Mickey Mouse for at least 100 shorts, maybe more. Now make that at least 101.

title: Finding Holiday Good Will in Glasses of Juice
description: WELCHS most essential ingredient comes from vines, so its fitting that for a new cause-marketing effort the grape products brand is turning to Vine, the mobile app for sharing six-second video clips.

title: Jury Acquits Mobster in 97 Killing of Officer
description: A former consigliere of the Colombo crime family was acquitted on Tuesday of the 1997 murder of a New York police officer. It was the second time a federal jury rejected arguments from prosecutors that leaders of the crime family ordered the killing.

title: What Does Black Friday Mean for You?
description: Black Friday, the day after Thanksgiving, has traditionally been the kickoff for the holiday shopping season, when Americans wake up in the pre-dawn hours (or never go to sleep) and race to malls and stores for the best deals. But in recent years, the holiday gift-buying countdown has been stretched even longer, with many retailers offering bargains on best-selling items days, even weeks, in advance of Black Friday.

title: Retailers Seek Partners in Social Networks
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Showrooming is no longer a bad word.

title: Home Sweet Home, Spoiled by Mold and Tight Quarters
description: As a grandmother, Sheila Cherry hews to the classic model. Her face lights up when she refers to her five grandchildren; she calls them her babies; she can easily recount their stories.

title: Shumpert, Knicks Starter, Struggles to Return to Relevance
description: LOS ANGELES  The Knicks escaped to California on Tuesday, though they were unable to leave their problems behind. A six-game losing streak trailed them to U.C.L.A., where they reviewed film (again) and practiced (again) and tried to unearth solutions (again) ahead of Wednesdays game against the Clippers.

title: A Plea to Avoid Crush of Users at Health Site
description: WASHINGTON  White House officials, fearful that the federal health care website may again be overwhelmed this weekend, have urged their allies to hold back enrollment efforts so the insurance marketplace does not collapse under a crush of new users.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Nov. 26, 2013
Philadelphia Schools Merged in Despair Find Reason to Celebrate in Football
description: PHILADELPHIA  The footballs. Where were they? The season was about to start and somebody forgot to bring the balls.

title: Egypts Jon Stewart on Comedy and Politics
description: During the administration of Mohamed Morsi, Egypts deposed president, Muslim Brotherhood partisans sought unsuccessfully to try Bassem Youssef, an Egyptian satirist and late-night talk show host, on charges of insulting the president. After Mr. Morsi was overthrown in the summer, Egyptians tuned in eagerly to the season premiere of Mr. Youssefs show in October to see if he would lampoon their new military rulers as harshly as he had the Islamists. His jokes clearly made an impact: One week later his show was abruptly suspended. Now he faces dozens of accusations of insulting the military  a potential crime.

title: In Steubenville Rape Case, a Lesson for Adults
description: A year ago this week, Michael McVey, the superintendent of schools in Steubenville, Ohio, sat in a conference room down the hall from his office and said he knew none of the details of Aug. 11, 2012, the night a 16-year-old girl was raped by two Steubenville High football players at a series of parties on a hot summer night.

title: Karzais Bet: U.S. Is Bluffing in Warning on Security Pact
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  When President Hamid Karzai met with an audience of supporters gathered by the Afghan state television network, RTA, six months ago, he was asked what he would consider a favorable conclusion to the security negotiations he was conducting with the United States.

title: Number of Settings
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  This is a special year. This year, THANKSGIVING overlaps with the first night of Hanukkah, an event that will not reoccur for another 70,000 years, so enjoy those sweet potato latkes while you can.

title: Suit Claims Racial Harassment at Security Firm With New York City Contracts
description: By now, the men are a familiar part of the post-Sept. 11 streetscape of Lower Manhattan, wearing black polo shirts and handling dogs trained to sniff out explosives. They work for MSA Security, a contractor that has made tens of millions of dollars guarding some of the citys ferry terminals and important buildings.

title: Life Term Given in Triple Murder Near Columbia University
description: Justice Thomas A. Farber is not given to fiery speeches or draconian sentences, but he made an exception on Tuesday in the case of a Bronx man convicted of executing three men in a car near Columbia University last year.

title: N.H.L. Reaches Lucrative Telecast Deal in Canada
description: In an agreement that will more than double its Canadian television revenue, the N.H.L. announced a 12-year, $4.9 billion deal Tuesday that gives Rogers Communications the exclusive rights to all national hockey telecasts in Canada beginning next season.

title: Jonathan C. Kushner
description: Mr. Kushner, 35, is the president of the Kushner Real Estate Group, which owns and manages more than 12 million square feet of commercial property in the New York area. It is involved in several projects in northern New Jersey.

title: More Talk, Little Movement Between the Yankees and Cano
description: The agents for Robinson Cano met with Yankee officials on Tuesday to continue their negotiations on a new contract, but little progress was made, according to a person who was briefed on the meeting.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate
description: RECENT SALE

title: Iraq: Suicide Bombers Kill 16 Soldiers and Policemen
description: Four suicide bombers struck northern Baghdad on Tuesday, targeting an army base and a police station, killing 10 soldiers and six policemen, police and medical officials said.

title: Corrections: November 27, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Egyptian Riot Police Attack Peaceful Protests in Cairo
description: CAIRO  The riot police brought a violent end to peaceful protests here on Tuesday, beating, sexually harassing and detaining some of Egypts most prominent human rights activists in a burst of repression that seemed likely to broaden opposition to the military-backed government.

title: Where Is Breast Cancer?
description: Women in wealthy countries are more likely to be diagnosed with breast cancer, but much less likely to die than women in the developing world.

title: An Intense Influx of Housing for a Honolulu District
description: The flat, low-slung neighborhood of Kakaako near downtown Honolulu was once an alluvial plain dotted with fish ponds that deteriorated into a gritty area with auto repair shops and warehouses.

title: The Cancer Divide: Tzippy
description: Tzippy, 38, an Orthodox Jew and a mother of seven children, recounted the choices she faced after testing positive for a genetic mutation associated with breast cancer.

title: In Israel, a Push to Screen for Cancer Gene Leaves Many Conflicted
description: KFAR SABA, Israel  Ever since she tested positive for a defective gene that causes breast cancer, Tamar Modiano has harbored a mothers fear: that she had passed it on to her two daughters. Ms. Modiano had her breasts removed at 47 to prevent the disease and said that the day she found out her older daughter tested negative was one of the happiest of her life.

title: U.S. B-52 Flight Prompts Indignant Reaction in China
description: Updated, 12:07 a.m. ET | News that the United States sent two B-52 bombers on a patrol through Chinas newly declared air defense zone prompted widespread criticism Wednesday on Chinese websites, both of the United States for an action many Chinese commentators saw as provocative and of China for its lack of an immediate response.

title: Xi Pays Homage to Confucius, a Figure Back in Favor
description: Chinas Communist Party leader, Xi Jinping, likes venerating his forebears. Mr. Xi has made a reverential visit to a statue of Deng Xiaoping, the party patriarch who oversaw Chinas shift to a market economy. Mr. Xi has also paid respects to Mao Zedong, and to his own father, a revolutionary who served under Mao.

title: Changing Assistance for the Unemployed
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: The Power of a Daily Bout of Exercise
description: This week marks the start of the annual eat-too-much and move-too-little holiday season, with its attendant declining health and surging regrets. But a well-timed new study suggests that a daily bout of exercise should erase or lessen many of the injurious effects, even if you otherwise lounge all day on the couch and load up on pie.

title: Firm Charged With Defying Sanctions Settles With U.S.
description: The United States on Tuesday announced one of the biggest settlements ever made for corporate misbehavior overseas, chronicling a litany of charges against a leading energy services provider. The charges included bribery and kickbacks in the Middle East and Africa and systematic defiance of economic sanctions on Iran and three other countries.

title: Sex Becomes a New Big Business in China
description: The Guangzhou National Sex Culture Festival is a mating ritual between capitalism and hedonism, all observed by a prudish chaperone: Chinas government.

title: A Place Where Capitalism and Hedonism Meet
description: Three decades after China began shedding its prudish Mao-era mores, sex is now a big business there.

title: With Glut of Lonely Men, China Has an Approved Outlet for Unrequited Lust
description: GUANGZHOU, China  Slack-jawed and perspiring, Chen Weizhou gazed at a pair of life-size female dolls clad, just barely, in lingerie and lace stockings. Above these silicone vixens, an instructional video graphically depicted just how realistic they felt once undressed.

title: Word of the Day | lunar
description: lunar \l-nr also -nr\ adjective

title: Bay Psalm Book Sets an Auction Record
description: A Puritan book of psalms printed in 1640 sold for more than $14 million at Sotheby's in New York Tuesday, a new record for a book. It will go on display in libraries across the United States.

title: Whats On Wednesday
description: 8 P.M. (13, 49) MY LIFE AS A TURKEY Joe Hutto can talk turkey, a result of having spent more than a year as a full-time parent to a clutch of wild hatchlings. This Emmy Award-winning film, the first installment in a Nature triple bill, listens as Mr. Hutto, a wildlife artist and environmentalist, recounts his efforts to bond with turkey poults the way their mother would, while viewers watch Jeff Palmer, above, a photographer and actor, recreate the experience by bonding with a brood of his own. The next thing Mr. Hutto knew, he was rearing 16 chicks, becoming especially fond of Sweet Pea, a snuggler, and Turkey Boy, the bold rascal of the bunch. He wrote about the experience in his book Illumination in the Flatwoods. An Original DUCKumentary, at 9, follows wood ducks, among the most vividly colored of the more than 120 duck species, as they bond, migrate across thousands of miles, nurture a brood of ducklings  including prodding them out of their nest, 70 feet up an oak tree, for their first flight  and return to their wintering grounds. Paul Giamatti narrates. And The Private Life of Deer, at 10, uses night vision cameras and GPS tracking to demystify the routines and rituals of the nearly 30 million whitetail deer that populate North America.

title: Bad Thanksgiving
description: The worst Thanksgiving I had came two days after they sliced me open, belly to pubic line, and the surgeon, coming to see me in recovery said, We got most of it.

title: Island Dispute Used to Argue Against Forced Eviction
description: In a country where standoffs between local governments and residents over land seizures and forced evictions regularly make headlines, one mans attempt to save his property by drawing parallels between his plight and a sovereignty dispute between China and Japan has drawn amused comment online.

title: In Raipur, Tribal Artists Finding Fewer Spaces for Self-Expression
description: RAIPUR, Chhattisgarh  As rain played hide-and-seek on an overcast September evening, keeping many residents of Raipur, the capital of Chhattisgarh, confined to their homes, a group of about 20 tribal artists from conflict-ridden Bastar assembled in a dormitory in the back of a state-run museum. Insulated from the outside world, they practiced a range of dance and folk music exclusively devoted to their deities, and unique to their regions and subculture.

title: News Quiz | November 27, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: German Rivals Reach Pact for Coalition Government
description: BERLIN  After five weeks of negotiations, Chancellor Angela Merkels conservatives reached an agreement on Wednesday with their Social Democratic rivals on a program for a new coalition government, with concessions to the left that pleased labor leaders and almost immediately drew criticism from business interests.

title: Grappling With Decisions About Testing and Treatment
description: Many geneticists and cancer doctors in Israel suggest that the Israeli Health Ministry offer genetic testing for all Ashkenazi women over the age of 25.

title: From Todays Paper: A Murmuration Taking Flight, and Shape
Test Yourself | Math, Nov. 27, 2013
description: Our weekly math problems are written by teachers at Math for America.

title: 6 Qs About the News | The Changing American Family
description: In The Changing American Family, Natalie Angier writes about the multiple ways in which American families have never been more diverse, more surprising, more baffling.

title: Vivendi to Spin Off Its Internet and Mobile Unit
description: LONDON  The French conglomerate Vivendi has announced plans to spin off its mobile and Internet unit as early as next year, after a wave of deals that has increased the value of its European telecommunications rivals.

title: After Challenges, China Appears to Backpedal on Air Zone
description: BEIJING  China has permitted rare street protests and sent armadas of fishing boats to show its growing national interest in a small string of islands in the East China Sea. Earlier this year, the Chinese military locked its radar on a Japanese navy vessel.

title: Chinas Airspace Claim Inflames Ties to South Korea, Too
description: South Koreas foreign minister warned on Wednesday that Chinas recent attempt to police the sky over a vast area in the East China Sea was worsening tensions in a region already strained by territorial disputes.

title: Finding Comfort and Food on Lines
description: This is the time for food lines. No, not the ones where people wait to buy artisanal cheeses, organic turkeys and handmade pies for Thanksgiving. Its the time for food lines because the end of the month is near, which for many families means their food stamp allotment has run out and dollars are tight.

title: Who Is Your Family?
description: What does family mean to you? Do you count only those bound to you by blood or legal ties, or do friends or other kinds of communities also fill some of the traditional role of family for you? How diverse is your family in terms of ethnic, racial, religious, political or other kinds of categories? What role does your family, however you define it, play in your life in general?

title: Dispute Over Immigration Widens Between Britain and E.U.
description: LONDON  Responding to political pressure from his right and public fears about an influx of Romanians and Bulgarians early next year, Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain said on Wednesday that he would restrict state benefits for European Union migrants, including a ban on housing subsidies for new arrivals and sharp limits on unemployment compensation.

title: Protesters Take Drive to Oust Government Beyond Bangkok
description: BANGKOK  Protesters seeking to overthrow the Thai government expanded their campaign outside of Bangkok on Wednesday, massing at more than a dozen municipal buildings across Thailand and forcing the evacuation of the countrys main criminal investigative agency on the outskirts of the capital.

title: New York Today: Feeding Stomachs and Souls
description: Updated 12:34 p.m.

title: Times Minute: Nov. 27 at 6 a.m.
description: Health deadline looming; the cancer divide; and the president pardons a turkey.

title: The New York Times Minute
description: In the Video

title: An American Neurotic in Paris
description: PARIS  A few years back I took the ultimate expatriate plunge: I started doing psychotherapy in French. I figured that, as part of the deal, Id get free one-on-one French lessons. And I hoped that if I revealed my innermost thoughts in French, I might finally feel like an ordinary Parisian  or at least like an ordinary Parisian neurotic.

title: Daily Report: Retailers Turn to Social Media to Showcase Products
description: Just a few years ago, the retail industry was deeply shaken by a growing trend in store browsing: shoppers wandering around the aisles with their cellphones, surveying the merchandise while looking online for somewhere else to buy it for less, Elizabeth A. Harris reports.

title: The Turkeys Turkey Connection
description: Thanksgiving is the all-American holiday. Turkey is the all-American bird. It was here long before Columbus or the Pilgrims. Early explorers reported vast flocks of turkeys nesting in the magnolia forest. Turkeys are a lot more American than apple pie. But theyre named after a country 4,429 miles away.

title: Better Than a Meat Lollipop
description: The best cut of lamb might be the shoulder.

title: The Shadow Politics of Shadow Education
description: ISTANBUL  Shadow education is academic jargon for the way ordinary people bypass the failings of the formal school system by enlisting their children in special programs on the side. In Turkey, the practice is so widespread it has spawned a multibillion-dollar industry of private tutorial colleges that help students cram for highly competitive high-school and university entrance exams. Nearly 1.3 million children in Turkey are enrolled in more than 3,800 tutorial colleges.

title: Advice on How to Research Family History, Part 4
description: Here is the fourth and final set of answers from Elizabeth Shown Mills, a genealogist and historical writer who has been responding to readers questions about how to research family history using online sources, physical public records and the stories and DNA of living family members. Part one of her answers is here. Part 2 is here. Part 3 is here.

title: Flexing Autonomy, Pakistani Premier Picks Outsider to Lead Army
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  In the most crucial appointment of his new term, Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif on Wednesday chose a relative outsider, Lt. Gen. Raheel Sharif, to lead Pakistans powerful army.

title: A New Credit Boom
description: A $330 million loan package to a small, little-known company from Missouri highlights how a new credit boom is taking shape, five years after the bubble, Lynnley Browning reports in DealBook. The company, Learfield Communications, of Jefferson City, Mo., owns multimedia rights to more than four dozen college sports programs and made just under $40 million last year in a common measure of earnings. It borrowed the money from Deutsche Bank and GE Capital on Oct. 9. Though the loans were rated subprime, with few of the standard protections seen in ordinary debt, investors clamored to buy pieces of the loans, one of which pays annual interest of at least 8.75 percent.

title: Andhra Pradesh Set to Evacuate 250,000 people as Cyclone Lehar Nears Coast
description: HYDERABAD, Andhra Pradesh  The National Disaster Management Authority is planning to begin evacuations of at least 250,000 people in Andhra Pradesh as early as Wednesday night as Cyclone Lehar, the second big storm in a week to threaten the state, is expected to make landfall late Thursday afternoon.

title: CVS Caremark to Buy Infusion Business
description: CVS Caremark announced on Wednesday that it had agreed to buy the Coram infusion business from the Apria Healthcare Group for about $2.1 billion.

title: T HOLIDAY
description: Snazzy evening loafers add a touch of insouciance to a black-tie ensemble and a bit of prepster panache to a more casual jacket and jeans look.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: Video of Black Nativity
description: The director Kasi Lemmons brings the Langston Hughes musical Black Nativity to the big screen, with performances from Jennifer Hudson, Angela Bassett, Forest Whitaker and Jacob Latimore. In this video, Ms. Lemmons narrates a musical sequence from the film, the song Test of Faith, sung by Ms. Hudson.

title: Holiday | The Daily Gift: Mansur Gavriel Tote
description: Every day from now until Christmas, the editors of T are sharing their personal gift suggestions.

title: Safety of Aid Workers Is a Concern After Afghan Attacks
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Two fatal attacks on relief workers in Afghanistan in the past two days have raised concerns that insurgents are now deliberately targeting them, after years in which aid groups working independently of the military had been considered off limits.

title: Turn Smartphones and Tablets Into Helpful Elves
description: Its very nearly the season to be jolly  and stress out about buying gifts and throwing parties.

title: Understanding War Through Hanukkah
description: The chaos of battle swirled all around us. As the soldiers advanced, an explosion severed a chunk of the rock face with a thunderous crack. Children! What are you doing in there? yelled Mom. It was too late. In my eagerness to augment the sounds of war, I had lifted one end of the marble coffee table and dropped it to the floor. Mom burst into the living room and fixed her eyes on the damage. My sister Kate and I gulped and looked at our valiant comrades. There were four bears, three rabbits, six mice, one tiger and five dogs. Mom was not amused. Now we were in serious danger.

title: AppSmart: Holiday Shopping Helpers
description: With the holiday gift season here, some apps can help track who gets what and ensure that shoppers get the best deal.

title: Tracking Holiday Travel Delays in Real Time
description: Updated 1:12 p.m. Most air travelers were able to avoid major delays on Tuesday as a powerful storm moved up the East Coast and into the mid-Atlantic states. But on Wednesday, the busiest travel day of this Thanksgiving holiday week, they may not be so lucky, according to FlightAwares online, real-time interactive map.

title: Small Business Saturday Is Under Attack (From Small Businesses)
description: In the three years since American Express inaugurated its Small Business Saturday campaign, the event has become something of an institution  at least, according to American Express.

title: Want to Drive (or Smell) Like Ron Burgundy?
description: Anchorman 2 has spawned commercials and products.

title: Feast and Football
description: Thanksgiving Day football remains an N.F.L. tradition across the nation, with the televised games as much a part of the holiday as turkey and gravy.

title: Feast and Football
description: Turkey and football have gone together for as long as any fan can remember, and Thanksgiving Day football has been an N.F.L. tradition in Detroit and Dallas since 1934 and 1966. This year, as has been the case since 2006, there will be three games: the Lions will face the Packers, the Cowboys will play the Raiders and, at night, the Steelers will meet the Ravens.

title: Syria Will Attend Geneva Peace Talks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Syrian government announced on Wednesday that it will participate in talks scheduled for January to try to end the countrys civil war but added that its official delegation will attend with the blessing of President Bashar al-Assad and that it does not intend to hand over power to anyone.

title: Myanmars Empty Capital
description: Patrick Chappatte visits surreal Naypyidaw.

title: Good News! Hes Back!
description: LOS ANGELES  Ron Burgundy, his salon-quality hair gleaming on a drizzly late November evening, alighted from the stretch limousine in front of the Barnes & Noble in the Grove shopping mall here.

title: A Wiseguy Neighbor in Little Italy
description: Dear Diary:

title: Protests After Rejection of E.U. Deal
description: Scenes from Kiev, Ukraine, where protesters rallied against the government after it backed away from a deal that would have advanced the country's integration with the European Union.

title: Sometimes You Cant Beat the Postgame Spread
description: BUFFALO  The third period of the game between the Buffalo Sabres and the St. Louis Blues had just begun at the First Niagara Center, and the delivery from Ricotas Pizza & Subs had arrived at the security entrance right on time. The dressing room attendant met the delivery men, and together they lugged the order into the Blues room.

title: The Overlooked Secret to Great Performance
description: Think of a time when you were performing at your best and another occasion when you were performing at your worst. Now, take a few moments to visualize the two occasions in your mind.

title: Toy Company Pulls Beastie Boys Song From Viral Video
description: A San Francisco-area toy company offered an olive branch to the Beastie Boys on Wednesday, saying that it had no intentions of fighting the rap group over a popular online video that used a parody of the bands song Girls. The company has removed the parody song from the video.

title: Execution-Style Killings in Iraq Raise Fears of Return to Sectarian Violence
description: BAGHDAD  A family of five killed in their home. A group of men shot dead in a field. Eight bodies, tied up in cable, discovered on a farm, each with a bullet in the head.

title: Chinese Claim Forces Obama to Flesh Out His Asia Strategy
description: WASHINGTON  While foreign-policy experts and risk analysts were riveted by the nuclear talks with Iran last weekend, the next major geopolitical crisis erupted a world away, over a clump of desolate islands in the choppy waters between Japan and China.

title: Image of the Day: November 27
Meryl Streep, Embodying Her Generation
description: The actresss roles have captured the personal and family dramas of many people who came of age in the late 60s and early 70s.

title: In Tanzania, Farmers Reap the Benefits of Radio
description: ARUSHA, Tanzania

title: Mirror, Mirror on the Screen
description: More than any performer of her era, Meryl Streep, 64, has reflected the hopes and fears of her moviegoing contemporaries, who have aged with her and seen their lives reflected in the roles she played, decade by decade.

title: Online and Offline Stores Duke It Out This Week
description: For many Americans, after the Thanksgiving plates are cleared and the leftovers are packed up, its time to put on comfy shoes and hit the shopping mall in search of deals and bargains for Black Friday.

title: A Red Auction (With Carpet to Match)
description: Many bidders at Bonos Red Auction at Sothebys last Saturday wore the color of the occasion. Gayle King had on a tight red gown. Chelsea Clinton wore red shoes. The model Anne V sported red lipstick.

title: Paratransit: Stuck in the Slow Lane
description: I have always found it reassuring to see New Jersey Transits striped Access Link vans motoring around my suburban town and to spot New York Citys Access-a-Ride vehicles criss-crossing Manhattan. Elderly and disabled people I know have used them, and while they have sometimes grumbled about having to wait too long for pick-ups, the vans have taken them where they needed to go.

title: No Pecan Pie? Thank China, Rain and Pigs
description: OCILLA, Ga.  It is a meager holiday in the pecan groves of the South, and the pain is stretching to kitchens across the country.

title: The Case for Techno-optimism
description: The debate over secular stagnation has shown some signs of getting confused with the debate over technological stagnation; its important to understand that they are not the same thing. What Bob Gordon (pdf) is predicting is disappointment on the supply side; what Larry Summers and I have been suggesting is that we may face a persistent shortfall on the demand side. Its true that Gordons world might suffer from low investment demand, since investment demand depends more on the rate of growth than it does on the level of real GDP. Still, they are distinct concepts.

title: Bookshelf | Edmund White Dishes on His Colorful Paris Years
description: Edmund Whites new tell-all paints a lavish picture of his time in Paris  with some not-so-flattering sketches of the characters he met there.

title: The Trouble With Economics Is Economists
description: Thats in large part what Simon Wren-Lewis is saying in this post defending mainstream economics. And I largely agree.

title: The Lives They Loved: Submit Your Memories
description: Updated, 12:04 p.m. | We are once again inviting readers to contribute to The Lives They Lived, the magazines celebration of people who died in the past year. We would like photographs that illustrate a moment in the life of someone close to you who died in 2013. This is not a place for eulogies or obituaries, but for stories. (View submissions from 2012 and 2011.)

title: Merger of American and US Airways Is Waved Ahead
description: With American Airlines exit from bankruptcy on Wednesday, the grunt work of merging the airline with US Airways can begin and it will most likely be a long-haul affair, analysts said.

title: Shopping for Fall Fashion? Dont Fear the Dark
description: When it comes to boots this season, midnight blue is the coolest color. You can wear them pretty much interchangeably with your beloved black. Pair with bluejeans, various warm layers or, perhaps, a smart gray coat for a casually refined look. To dress up, slip them on with a black skirt (or even black leather pants) and a white blouse. The blue will prove unexpected and polished. Just dare to try.

title: Youre Here to Be Lectured
description: In the context of the Brooklyn Academy of Musics Next Wave Festival, which scours the globe for cutting-edge performances, the presence of an Oscar winner qualifies as exotica. But this week, Frances McDormand, who won Hollywoods big prize for Fargo, takes to the intimate Fishman Space stage to portray Suzanne Bocanegra giving a lecture in Bodycast. Ms. Bocanegras works range across mediums: she paints, creates large-scale installations and orchestrates complex interdisciplinary events, often involving other artists. Paul Lazar, who directs Bodycast, portrayed Ms. Bocanegra giving a lecture in Ms. Bocanegras When a Priest Marries a Witch, to which Bodycast is a quasi-sequel. In the new piece, which includes guest appearances by the singer Theo Bleckmann and the dancer Emily Coates, Ms. Bocanegra reflects (in the person of Ms. McDormand) on evolving ideals of female beauty, among other topics, as refracted through her experience of wearing a body cast for two years in her teens to correct her scoliosis. (Opens Tuesday, Fisher Building, 321 Ashman Place, near Lafayette Avenue, Fort Greene; bam.org.)

title: Fantasy Football: Week 13 Matchup Breakdown
description: If you are the fantasy owner of a Kansas City Chiefs offensive player other than Jamaal Charles, specifically the teams quarterback and top wide receiver, you may finally get to be thankful this season  and just in time for the all-important Week 13, the final week of the regular season for many fantasy teams.

title: Ask Well: Genetic Testing for Breast Cancer
description: Some Israeli doctors want Israel to conduct a national screening campaign to test all Jewish Israeli women of Ashkenazi descent for harmful genetic mutations that heighten the risk of breast and ovarian cancer. The debate is detailed in the article, In Israel, a Push to Screen for Cancer Gene Leaves Many Conflicted.

title: Law of Gravity, Made to be Broken
description: In the middle of AfterMidnight, the acclaimed jazz revue at the Brooks Atkinson Theater, two dapper men dance a sinuous, playful duet. As they move  to the driving strains of Hottentot, played by the Jazz at Lincoln Center All Stars  laws of physics shatter. These men force time to slow and speed. Their bodies curve in ways that would stagger Newton.

title: Whats Next? The Poky Little Pediatrician?
description: Never underestimate the commercial potential of bored parents.

title: My Religion. My Mother-in Law. Our Thanksgivukkah.
description: One of my most testy mother-in-law moments came over holiday wrapping paper. A few months into my husbands conversion to Judaism, we were discussing why Christmas was a bright, intractable line for me  and now us  and how her grandchildren (at the time, theoretical) would never be able to celebrate Christmas morning with their Catholic grandparents.

title: The N.S.A. Dips Into Pornography
description: There is so much thats outrageous about American spy agencies data collection programs that I felt slightly guilty this morning when I burst into laughter at the latest revelation from the Snowden papers.

title: Berlusconi Expelled From Senate in Italy After 2 Decades in Government
description: ROME  Having spent months manufacturing procedural delays and conjuring political melodrama in hopes of saving himself, Silvio Berlusconi could no longer stave off the inevitable: Italys Senate stripped him of his parliamentary seat on Wednesday, a dramatic and humiliating expulsion, even as other potential troubles await him.

title: De Professor
description: De Professor performing God Nah Sleep at this years calypso competition in Guyana.

title: Springsteens Handwritten Born to Run Lyrics Head to Auction
description: The lyrics to Born to Run, the evocative title track of Bruce Springsteens third album, from 1975, seem to roll off Mr. Springsteens tongue on the recording, a torrent of inspired urban car-culture imagery. But a page torn from a spiral-bound notebook that once belonged to Mr. Springsteen, which is currently up for auction at Sothebys, shows that it was a long road from Mr. Springsteens early thoughts about the song to its finished version.

title: Macys Parade Balloons Come Alive, With the Wind Closely Watched
description: SpongeBob SquarePants and Snoopy lay on their bellies on the pavement of West 77th Street in Manhattan on Wednesday evening, the giant balloons netted and tethered to the ground. Spectators to the inflation of the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade balloons streamed by, children in strollers pointing out their favorites, parents pulling tiny parkas closed and shoving little hats down on heads as the wind steadily picked up throughout the afternoon.

title: After the Parade, a Macys Christmas Musical
description: The music  and marketing  of the Macys Thanksgiving Day Parade will not end when the last float makes its way to the flagship store on 34th Street on Thursday morning. A musical developed by the Macys parade team will get its concert hall premiere next month when the Cincinnati Pops Orchestra performs Macys Presents Yes, Virginia in Concert.

title: Classical Playlist: Martha Argerich, Third Coast Percussion, Garrick Ohlsson and More
description: Times critics share what theyve been listening to lately.

title: Venice by Kayak
description: A new trip offered by Tofino Expeditions will give active travelers a different view of the city of canals by exploring Venice on an eight-day kayaking tour.

title: Moncler Sets Price Range for Public Offering
description: Updated, 7:57 p.m. |

title: Sampling a Tasty Sliver of Singapores Cuisine
description: On the small sidewalk that hugs a corner coffee shop in the Tiong Bahru neighborhood in Singapore, a long line was once again firmly in place. Though it was just late morning, people had gathered to make sure theyd get a morsel of the lunch treats sold out of the closet-size stall that is Loos Hainanese Curry Rice.

title: Navigating Art Fairs in Miami and Beyond
description: Art takes over Miami next week, with fairs setting up shop in convention centers, studios and hotel rooms across the city. To name just a few, exhibitions will be held by Art Basel Miami Beach, Art Miami, Scope Miami, Pulse Miami and the New Art Dealers Alliance.

title: The American Family: Reader Comments
description: American households have never been more diverse, more surprising, more baffling. In this weeks Science Times, Natalie Angier takes stock of the changing definition of family. Read their stories in The Changing American Family, and post your comments below.

title: The New York Times Minute
description: In the Video

title: Apples Pages, Going the Distance With Word
description: My mother is not anti-Apple. She owns a Mac and an older iPad, but has always been perfectly satisfied with her trusty copy of Microsoft Word. Thats what everyone uses, she says.

title: In Our Pages: November 28
description: 1888: French Oppose Income Tax

title: Thanksgiving, by the Numbers
description: From parades to pumpkins, the facts and figures behind this year's Thanksgiving holiday.

title: A Prediction: Bitcoin Is Doomed to Fail
description: The developers of bitcoin are trying to show that money can be successfully privatized. They will fail, because money that is not issued by governments is always doomed to failure. Money is inevitably a tool of the state.

title: A History of the Presidential Turkey Pardon
description: Like most American traditions, the presidential turkey pardon is wrought with intrigue and legend. Now a holiday staple, the pardon was once merely a presentation  with the chosen birds going to the gallows rather than a farm in Virginia. Most presidents have had turkeys formally given to them, but it was not until the first President George Bush officially used the word pardon during the ceremony in 1989 that the custom formally began.

title: Times Minute: Nov. 27 at Noon
description: New leadership in Pakistan; a pecan shortage; and Ron Burgundy in real life.

title: Wedding Q. and A.
description: Which Co-Workers on Invitation List?

title: Accidental Detour Leads to Deep Snow
description: In this episode of Teton Gravity Researchs Behind the Line, a group of skiers encounters snowstorms and icy roads before finding deep snow in Fieberbrunn.

title: Video: Accidental Detour Leads Skiers to Deep Snow
description: Behind the Line is a video series produced by Teton Gravity Research that takes you into the minds of skiers. In each episode, the athletes will look back on a line, a jump or a session, and discuss the moment.

title: Video: A Texas Flower Girl
description: Lisa Taye Cohen was recently walking to work in the South Congress neighborhood in Austin, Tex., sporting rolled-up denim shorts, a Rolling Stones tank top and vintage cowboy boots.

title: The Hills Are Alive on Long Island
description: On Dec. 5, NBC will broadcast a live version of The Sound of Music starring the country music star Carrie Underwood.

title: The Hills Are a Prop, the Show Is Live
description: Weeks before The Sound of Music goes live for one night only on NBC, the actors were fretting about some scenes more than others.

title: Aiming to Build Customer Loyalty in Hands-On Activities
description: Back in 2008, still early in the economic crisis, Butter Lane Cupcakes opened its doors in the East Village of Manhattan. With business slow, the co-founders, Pam Nelson, Maria Baugh and Linda Lea, decided they needed to try something different to get people into the shop, and they hit on the idea of offering classes in cupcake making.

title: Qatar Lets Soccer Player Leave After Two Years
description: Zahir Belounis, a French-Algerian soccer player who has been unable to leave Qatar for more than two years because of a contract dispute with his former club, and whose case shined a light on the emirates labor laws, has been told he can return home.

title: The Perils of Anti-Decadence
description: My Sunday column tried to draw a serious point out of the coincidence of Aldous Huxley, C.S. Lewis and John F. Kennedy all entering the hereafter within a few hours of each other, portraying the resilience of the Kennedy mythos as, in part, a kind of secular/liberal rebellion against the same disenchanted utilitarian materialism that both Huxley and Lewis famously critiqued. This is a reason, I wrote, for even J.F.K. skeptics like myself to feel a little sympathy for the cult of Camelot because it speaks to a deep and admirable human desirefor grace and beauty, for icons and heroes, for a high-stakes dimension to human affairs that a consumerist, materialist civilization can flatten and exclude. Thevarious things that J.F.K.s admirers cite when they praise the man and his administration  the physical vigor and the soaring rhetoric, the patronage of high culture and the man-on-the-moon technological ambition, the Cuban Missile Crisis drama and the founding of the Peace Corps  might not match up to a reality that was much more personally sleazy, culturally incurious and geopolitically reckless. But better a slightly bogus vigah than a society that deliberately cultivates what Lewis termed men without chests. Better a gap between self-sacrificial aspirations and grubbier realities than a society like Huxleys Brave New World that excludes any dreams higher than comfort and consumption.

title: Researchers Retract Report That Linked Bitcoin Creator and Silk Road
description: Two Israeli computer scientists who over the weekend published a paper describing a financial connection between the Bitcoin peer-to-peer transaction system and the operator of Silk Road, an Internet black market, have backed away from the claim after an independent security researcher took responsibility for the puzzling account that generated the transfer.

title: Last Call for Student Hamlet Videos
description: As part of The New York Timess deep dive into a Shakespeare-heavy theater season, we invited student actors to submit Instagram videos of their own 15-second scenes from Hamlet.

title: What Have You Seen Businesses Doing to Get Customers in the Door?
description: Weve just published a story about small businesses that are using classes and events to get customers in the door. One example is the Woodinville Whiskey Company in Woodinville, Wash., which holds bottling parties, where customers bottle, label, cork and case whiskey. These efforts are rewarded with a bottling crew T-shirt, a discount on anything they buy that night and dinner.

title: And So to Bed
description: If breakfast is the most important meal of the day, surely the half-hour or so before bed is, for families, the days most important moment: a time to reflect on the past, plan fortomorrow, and read together. Three new picture books for bedtime offer very different pleasures for children of different ages and temperaments.

title: Daylight and $69 Million Transform a Queens Museum
description: Chances seemed pretty dim nine years ago that the plan to reconstruct and expand the Queens Museum of Art would have a happy architectural ending.

title: Believe in Eternity, or at Least 100 Years
description: Nathaniel Merrills 1969 production of Strausss Rosenkavalier is the oldest in the Metropolitan Operas repertory. Its opulent Rococo sets, furnished with loving historical details, have played home to singers including Christa Ludwig, Tatiana Troyanos and Luciano Pavarotti. And yet Friday evenings season premiere with a wonderful cast  many singing these roles for the first time at the Met  felt utterly fresh. Witty, elegant and profoundly moving, the production continues to be an excellent vehicle for Strausss reflection on the impermanence of the human existence and loves power to nevertheless make us believe in eternity.

title: Greek Editor Acquitted Anew Over Publication of Swiss Bank Account Names
description: ATHENS  A Greek magazine editor who caused a political storm a year ago when he published the names of more than 2,000 Greeks with Swiss bank accounts in a bid to shine a light on unpunished tax evasion was cleared of violating privacy laws on Wednesday.

title: Lighting Up the Lawn With 16 Million Colors
description: It starts with an innocent string of incandescent holiday lights around a porch window, maybe a plastic caroler or two on the front lawn.

title: Online Health Law Sign-Up Is Delayed for Small Business
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Wednesday announced a one-year delay in a major element of the new health care law that would allow small businesses to buy insurance online for their employees through the new federal marketplace.

title: Rich Twits, Back in the Day
description: Somehow its comforting to know that silly rich people were ever thus.

title: 100 Notable Books of 2013
description: The years notable fiction, poetry and nonfiction, selected by the editors of The New York Times Book Review.

title: This Weeks Movies: Nov. 27, 2013
description: The New York Times film critics on Oldboy, Black Nativity and Frozen.

title: Market Report | Evening Shoes for Guys Who Want to Step Out
description: Snazzy evening loafers add a touch of insouciance to a black-tie ensemble and a bit of prepster panache to a more casual jacket and jeans look.

title: Party Claims It Identified Top C.I.A. Spy in Pakistan
description: The political party of the former cricket star Imran Khan on Wednesday identified a man it described as the C.I.A.'s top spy in Pakistan, in an escalation of Mr. Khans campaign to end American drone strikes in the country.

title: A Giant Among Men
description: Those of us at Harvard who took the seminar on Swift and Pope offered by the eminent scholar and specialist George Sherburn elicited the professors savage indignation as he returned our papers, many of which had called Swift ferocious. I chuckled, thinking myself innocent of the charge, until I received my paper with a furiously circled ferocious in it.

title: Game? What Game? Lets Tailgate
description: BATON ROUGE, La.  Just how legendary is the tailgating culture at Louisiana State University? Legendary enough to draw Allison DiBenedetto, a 28-year-old teacher from Staten Island, to the L.S.U. campus over homecoming weekend to celebrate her bachelorette party with a group of friends. Never mind that Ms. DiBenedetto didnt attend L.S.U., and her wedding isnt until September of next year.

title: Europe Urges U.S. to Handle Data Privacy With Care
description: LONDON  The European Commission demanded on Wednesday that the American authorities take greater care in protecting European citizens personal data. But it did not take steps to change the rules that allow American companies like Google and Microsoft to compile that data.

title: A Region Totters Toward Democracy, Gathering Momentum
description: NEW DELHI  At a certain point this fall, the presidential elections in the Maldives stopped looking like the hiccups of a young democracy and veered into the realm of farce.

title: Video Reviews of Oldboy, Black Nativity and Frozen
description: In this weeks video, Times critics offer their thoughts on Spike Lees dark thriller Oldboy, Kasi Lemmonss musical Black Nativity and the latest animated film from Walt Disney Pictures, Frozen. See more of this weeks reviews.

title: Calendar: Coming Events in Florida and Australia
description: Key West Literary Seminar, Florida

title: Norma Kamali Is Playing Dress-Up With Sweatshirts
description: WHO COULD HAVE PREDICTED a couple of years ago that the homebody sweatshirt would attain high-fashion status? Well, Norma Kamali, for one. It was, after all, Ms. Kamali who in the late 70s transformed this downtime staple, linked with the locker room and the living room couch, into a fashion trophy.

title: Cold War Tensions Reheated
description: The Hunt for Red October might better have been called The Hunt for a Paramount Thriller Franchise. In 1990, the sun had just set on the Reagan administration, but Paramount, the home of Top Gun, hungered for a property capitalizing on the presidents brand of patriotism. Filling the bill were the best-selling novels of Tom Clancy, a former Baltimore insurance salesman with a passion for high-tech Defense Department lingo and jingoism. (He died in October.) Reagan himself said Clancys Red October was my kind of yarn.

title: Newly Released Books
description: This month, fiction with grim edges, including a hustlers lonely life, a possible assassination in Mexico City, women emotionally adrift and a murderer on the run. Also, a look at Richard Pryors career and a literary miscellany.

title: Hope Doesnt Come Out of a Bottle
description: For 20 years, Conor McPherson ended most of his plays with a faint hope of salvation  for the lonely souls in The Weir, the therapist and patient in Shining City, and the Everyman alcoholic in The Seafarer, to name his three works that had critically acclaimed runs on Broadway. But his latest play, The Night Alive, tops them. Mr. McPherson, one of Irelands greatest living playwrights, has gone all in to render a powerful moment of redemption in the final scene  sure to be one of the most debated of the New York theater season, given that it leaves much room for interpretation.

title: Engineering His Own Vermeer
description: Tim Jenison has always thought of himself as an inventor, the kind of person who keeps a running list of practical puzzles for when he can devote spare brain cells to solving them.

title: Getting Secret Money Out of Campaigns
description: The Internal Revenue Service spent years averting its eyes while clever campaign operatives abused the tax code for political purposes. Advocacy groups, mostly on the right, wanted to run attack ads while concealing the source of their money, and they came up with a brilliant way to do it: claim to be social welfare groups, which are allowed to hide donors.

title: Brazil High Court Puts Off Depositor Ruling Until 2014
description: Updated, 7:30 p.m. |

title: Rise in Unprotected Sex by Gay Men Spurs H.I.V. Fears
description: Federal health officials are reporting a sharp increase in unprotected sex among gay American men, a development that makes it harder to fight the AIDS epidemic.

title: Living With Cancer: Giving Thanks and Latkes
description: When I consider how this Hanukkah will be different from all other Hanukkahs, I wonder if my giddiness can be attributed to cancer and the treatments that have governed my life for the past five years.

title: Good Looks, Specially Wrapped
description: With the unusual convergence of Thanksgiving and Hanukkah, gift-giving season seems extra-long this year. Some of these specially packaged beauty products will help glamorize recipients for holiday parties, while others may just help them relax.

title: Thanksgivukkah Reading: A Lending Boom for the Devil Incarnate
description: To the dismay of regulators, investors are increasingly embracing to higher credit risk for the potential of higher returns.

title: italysyriarefuge-loop
description: italysyriarefuge-loop

title: How to Choose a Carry-On Bag
description: The Samsonite roll-aboard bag Ive been using for 15 years announced its retirement this spring, when a wheel tread ripped on a cobblestone street in Belfast. I coaxed it through the rest of the trip with duct tape and taxi rides, but it was clearly time to find a new carry-on  not a simple task, I quickly discovered.

title: Looking for an Edge During Holiday Travel
description: Connecting to technology may be the best way to get to loved ones this holiday season. Speed and efficiency are essential, and without an app or two in a back pocket, travelers could be stuck at the back of the line.

title: Latvian Premier Resigns Over Collapse of Building
description: VILNIUS, Lithuania  The prime minister of Latvia unexpectedly resigned on Wednesday, saying he was accepting political and moral responsibility for a building collapse last week that killed at least 54 people.

title: Hotel Review: Great Northern Hotel in London
description: Rates

title: A Powerful Image of Breast Cancer Offends Some Times Readers
description: Many Times readers were disturbed and offended by the front-page photograph of an Israeli womans upper torso in Wednesdays newspaper. It was the dominant image on the page, and it accompanied an article in a series called The Cancer Divide, which is examining how the treatment of breast cancer is shaped by wealth and poverty, culture and values.

title: What You Get for... $875,000
description: SCOTTSDALE, ARIZ.

title: What You Get for ... $875,000
description: Properties include an adobe-style house in Arizona, a Georgian in Virginia and a contemporary in Vermont.

title: Tidying Up the World
description: The year gone by was very, very messy. Heres how to set it straight.

title: Two Lucky Birds
description: On the eve of Thanksgiving, the president saves two turkeys from becoming dinner.

title: Moscow Says Louis Vuitton Doesnt Go With Red Square
description: MOSCOW  If Lenin were alive today, instead of spinning in his mausoleum nearby, he no doubt would be aghast at the two-story replica of a Louis Vuitton traveling trunk on Red Square. He might also update the title of his famous essay on the need for a revolutionary vanguard party, asking not What Is To Be Done but Why the Heck Was It Done?

title: In Bulgarias Charming Old-World Capital, a Modern Oasis
description: Until the beautifully designed 71-room Sense Hotel opened in June, luxury in Sofia, the handsome capital of Bulgaria, was often more defined by what the Balkan city doesnt have than what it does  which is a lot of character and un-self-conscious charm. Despite a population of 1.2 million, the city has none of the stress-tinged, work-centric rhythms found in most European capitals, existing instead in a gentle post-Ottoman twilight, its leafy neighborhoods still full of small cafes, bars and taverns. The arrival of Starbucks hasnt completely sidelined the local preference for Turkish coffee and the citys old market  where kerchiefed farm wives sell their pickles in recycled jars and there is an abundant supply of the delicious cheese-filled phyllo pastries known as banitsa  is still busy, despite the big supermarkets opening on the outskirts of town.

title: Shopping Events in New York Starting Nov. 28
description: Sales

title: My Favorite Ways to Kick the Bucket
description: Nobody at Warners died like me. Its the one thing I had a knack for.

title: Familiar Faces, Broad Humor
description: When its Kirstie Alley, size doesnt matter. But after bouts of self-mockery (Fat Actress) and a public weight-loss regimen (Jenny Craig and Dancing With the Stars), she has re-emerged: thinner, younger  at least in TV years  and ready for prime time once again.

title: Tourist Sites as Inspiration
description: A look at the work of the Chinese artist Sun Xun.

title: Inspiration Far From Home
description: When the Chinese artist Sun Xun was growing up in Fuxin, a small city near the North Korean border, he already knew that China was a country with at least two histories. In school, during the day, he studied the Chinese history presented in official accounts, a version remarkably free of such troubling episodes as the Great Leap Forward or the Cultural Revolution.

title: Heading Wherever, Together
description: In the current issue of Billboard, at the end of the cover feature on One Direction, there is a cooling mist of reality spritzed by, who else, Simon Cowell, the TV judge-impresario who helped Frankenstein this group into existence on the 2010 season of the British version of The X Factor.

title: Musical Underground
description: Xuefei Yang, a gifted guitarist who is said to have been the first guitar major at Beijings Central Conservatory of Music, will perform at SubCulture on Tuesday in a show presented by the 92nd Street Y. This intimate new subterranean space on Bleecker Street has joined Le Poisson Rouge, among others, as a prominent downtown platform for classical music. Ms. Yang, who has several records on EMI Classics, will perform works by Britten (whose centennial is being celebrated this season) as well as pieces by Ginastera, Chen Yi and Mertz. (7:30 p.m. Tuesday, 45 Bleecker Street, Greenwich Village, 212-415-5500, 92y.org.)

title: Whitish Gray, Also Quite Green
description: An event of a relatively permanent nature may overshadow the five-day confab of art fairs that will descend on Miami this week: the inauguration of the striking Prez Art Museum Miami (formerly the Miami Art Museum) in Bicentennial Park on the Bay of Biscayne. The whitish-gray, mostly environmentally green building is the latest museum from Herzog & de Meuron, which designed the expansion of the Walker Art Center in Minneapolis and the De Young Museum in San Francisco. The three-story 120,000 square-foot building consists of a group of geometric volumes that seem almost to levitate between a base of several platforms and an immense perforated canopy overhead. In addition to reducing energy consumption, the canopy will support one of the museums most distinctive features: a hanging garden of native plants irrigated by collected rainwater. The effect is of an expanded Corbusier villa that has absorbed its greensward. The opening exhibitions seem bent on making the most of the museums small collection and nearly 31,000 square feet of gallery space, but with a probable destination building like this, it may not matter.

title: Braided Bodies Up Onstage
description: It cant be easy being the artistic director of one of Americas most beloved dance companies, but Robert Battle  after a little more than two years on the job  is gradually and imaginatively giving his dancers a reason to have an extra bounce in their steps. Beginningon Wednesday, his troupe, the versatile Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, will unveil Wayne McGregors Chroma, originally choreographed for the Royal Ballet in 2006. The work pits John Pawsons stark set against Joby Talbots original compositions and arrangements of music by the White Stripes. It was also the dance that led to Mr. McGregors appointment as resident choreographer at the Royal Ballet.

title: Seeing Beauty With Saul Leiter
description: Tony Cenicola thought he was leaving behind the world of being a photo assistant to start his own studio. He had been helping a photographer move into a lower Fifth Avenue studio duplex in 1985 when its owner was struck by something: Mr. Cenicola could pack delicate cameras and gear. Soon, Mr. Cenicola got a call from that photographer to be his assistant. He spent the next 10 years working with Saul Leiter, an important figure in the New York School. Mr. Leiter died late Tuesday night in New York City. Mr. Cenicola, who is now a staff photographer at The New York Times, recalled his time assisting  and learning from  Mr. Leiter. His conversation with David Gonzalez has been edited into a first-person narrative.

title: West Coast Style, by the Numbers
description: The rapper who calls himself 100s has a genuinely beautiful mane of hair not seen since the days of Suga Free, and thats not an accident: 100s is part of the proud California pimp-rap legacy, and aesthetics matter. On his self-released debut album from last year, Ice Cold Perm, he raps with a smooth sneer over gooey tracks that recall the West Coast of the early-mid 1990s, a sound thats been undervalued historically. And his new singles Life of a Mack (also heard in the video game Grand Theft Auto V) and Keep a Bitch Broke  in advance of a new EP, IVRY (Fools Gold)  show an admirable commitment to keeping that style alive. 100s is the most exciting artist on the Turnt & Burnt tour  along with the headliner, ASAP Ferg  which comes to Irving Plaza this week, and also features various other members of the ASAP Mob, as well as Joey Fatts, Aston Matthews and OverDoz. (Friday at 7 p.m., 17 Irving Place, at 15th Street, Manhattan; irvingplaza.com.)

title: See Stanwyck, All Month Long
description: I recall watching The Big Valleyas a child, a western series on ABC about a family led by a matriarch who was smart, graceful, independent and tough (and partial to turtlenecks and black leather). Only later did I learn the true majesty of the star, billed on the show as Miss Barbara Stanwyck. Stanwyck (1907-90)  born Ruby Stevens in Flatbush, Brooklyn, and a former Ziegfeld chorus girl  had 35 years of movies behind her. Forty of her best films, many in 35-millimeter prints, appear in Stanwyck, a Film Forum celebration running FridaythroughDec. 31.

title: Civil Complaint Against MSA Security
description: Read the full civil complaint against MSA Security.

title: At Edward Hoppers Home, Legally This Time
description: As a mischievous boy in the late 1960s, Tony Oursler sneaked into Edward Hoppers childhood home, then unoccupied and in disrepair, and just blocks from where Mr. Ourslers family lived in Nyack, N.Y. Now an internationally recognized multimedia artist, Mr. Oursler has returned to the scene of his trespassing, today known as the Edward Hopper House Art Center, with Tony Oursler: hopped (popped), a site-specific installation that interweaves anecdotal snippets from his youth with biting reimaginings of Hoppers complicated 43-year marriage.

title: A Violin Prodigy, Now Grown
description: The seeds of Sirena Huangs professional relationship with Carolyn Kuan, music director of the Hartford Symphony Orchestra, were planted at the 2007 Eastern Music Festival in Greensboro, N.C. Ms. Huang, then a 12-year-old violinist in the Juilliard Schools pre-college division, was the soloist with a student orchestra conducted by Ms. Kuan, who was then assistant director of the Seattle Symphony Orchestra.

title: House Hunting Near Marseille
description: A house designed by the architect Andr Stern is on the market for $2.6 million.

title: House Hunting Near ... Marseille
description: A MODERN VILLA IN THE COASTAL TOWN OF ST.-CYR-SUR-MER

title: Digital Passivity
description: I fear that 2013 will be remembered as a tragic and dark year in the digital universe, despite the fact that a lot of wonderful advances took place.

title: From the Editor
description: The experts we corralled for our Conversation on aging, as you are about to discover, agree that we are pushing death farther and farther back, so that many of us may now expect to live a century or more. I find this most heartening, sharing as I do the common fear of the Reaper. But I am also aware that I and my fellow centenarians will pose some difficult new problems for our 80-year-old kids and 60-something grandkids, problems memorably identified by the Beatles back in the day: Will you still need me, will you still feed me, when Im one-oh-four?

title: So Many Sounds, but Jazz Is the Core
description: LOS ANGELES  Herbie Hancock, a pianist of sparkling touch and brisk intuition, has often seemed like a figure rushing ever onward, and the direction in which he has increasingly hurled himself is globe-trotting cultural diplomacy. I dont consider myself a spokesperson for jazz, he said recently, implying that he has bigger concerns.

title: Week 13 N.F.L. Game Probabilities: The Value of Aaron Rodgers
description: The model used here to produce the game probabilities is a parametric model, meaning its inputs are parameters that can be varied easily. Thats obviously a good thing, as team statistics certainly vary from week to week. Its also handy because those parameters can be manually adjusted to account for injuries and just to play what-if.

title: The Past in Our Future
description: I recently took my 16-year-old daughter Adele to see a section of the Berlin Wall that has been preserved as part of a museum devoted to the division of the city, Germany and Europe. It was a bright Berlin morning. Tourists gazed at the wall. They read placards describing the young lives lost in attempts at escape from the Soviet empire. Adele, born in 1997, with just a toehold in the last century, wandered around. She examined these curious relics. Every now and again she checked her Facebook page on her device. This just seems so ancient, she said, leaning back against the wall. I mean, it feels like it comes from the 19th century.

title: Our Compass
description: In each issue, the editors of Turning Points invite contributors to explore one of the big questions of the year. For 2013 we asked Elif Shafak, Salam Fayyad, Liao Yiwu, Rowan Williams, Mikhail Khodorkovsky and Mata Amritanandamayi Devi: Who are the moral leaders for these times?

title: Cyber Subterfuge
description: I awoke one morning to a disturbing email from the software giant Adobe. The message warned that thieves had hacked into the companys servers, stolen the source code for some of its software products and almost three million passwords and credit card details, among which might be mine. It included a link to reset my password.

title: An Unlikely Throne for Dance Royalty
description: SARASOTA, Fla.  Michelangelos David framed by palm trees: The image may seem incongruous, but its a semiofficial symbol for this resort city on the Gulf Coast of Florida. A bronze version of that Italian Renaissance sculpture has long stood in a bayside courtyard of the Ringling Museum of Art here, part of the collection of European antiquities and old master paintings that the circus tycoon John Ringling imported in the early 1900s. Along with a long-established opera company, orchestra and repertory theater, the museum explains why Sarasota is accustomed to billing itself as Floridas Cultural Coast.

title: The World of Mars
description: We have an unknown distance yet to run, an unknown river to explore. What falls there are, we know not; what rocks beset the channel, we know not; what walls ride over the river, we know not. Ah, well! we may conjecture many things.  John Wesley Powell

title: Leaving Home Coming Home
description: Organizing ones address book is always a thankless task. Every year, from my home in Havana, I attack the job of reviewing, page by page, all the names and data that make up my network of personal and professional relationships. Like a tapestry in which I am barely one strand, I review every thread that remains and each thread that was lost. And I find myself facing the alarming evidence of how many people I must subtract.

title: Power in 2030: The Roads We May Take
description: There is no question that we are at a turning point in world energy. But then we are often at a turning point. Just as everybody gets comfortable with what they expect to happen, a big change comes along that undercuts existing assumptions. Just consider:

title: Father to a Nation, and to a Family
description: Zindzi Mandelas earliest memory is sitting outside a Pretoria, South Africa, police station in 1962 while her mother, Winnie, delivered a favorite dish to her father, Nelson Mandela, being held inside.

title: Deep Cover
description: Please, what is my name  you have to tell me my name! I was on the corner of 72nd Street and Broadway in New York, talking with the urgency of a madwoman into my cellphone.

title: After Recovery, a Return Fit for Longing and Loss
description: When the tenor Rolando Villazn last sang at the Metropolitan Opera in 2009, he suffered various mishaps, prompting cancellations attributed to laryngitis and other illnesses. He sought medical advice and was told he would probably never sing again. He was eventually found to have a congenital internal cyst on his left vocal cord; after surgery in 2009, he relearned first how to speak and then how to sing, making a sometimes unsteady foray back into the professional opera world.

title: Women Rising
description: In a Belfast hotel last spring, stories of children and life floated through the rooms.

title: Drug War No More
description: After covering drug trafficking and violence in Latin America since 2001, I look through endless photos and videos and ask myself what would be its single most iconic image  one that people could look at in a hundred years and understand.

title: A Force of 120 Million
description: I met Sharmila Devi when the youngest of her four children, Babita, was 4 months old. After Babita was born, Sharmila made a brave decision that will give her children a good chance at a better future.

title: Euro Marriage in Peril
description: On the morning of July 26, 2012, I was meeting with the central bank governor of a country at the core, or stable center, of the euro zone. He was telling me that the European Central Bank could do little to rescue peripheral countries like Italy and Spain, whose interest rates were going through the roof.

title: Do I Dare to Eat a Peach?
description: This discussion was held in London in partnership with the lecture curator 5x15. The moderator was Serge Schmemann, editor of the Magazine. The participants were Sarah Harper, a British gerontologist and founder of the Oxford Institute of Population Aging; Babatunde Osotimehin, a physician and former Nigerian minister of health who is executive director of UNFPA, the United Nations Populations Fund; and Ruby Wax, an American-born, London-based comedian, writer, TV personality and mental-health campaigner.

title: Fashions Latest Muse
description: In the early 1980s, Bonwit Teller, the Fifth Avenue department store, asked a few designers to create looks for their windows. The instruction: What will we be wearing in the year 2000? Instead of designing a dress, I painted a leopard-print skin on a mannequin. Little did I know the wrap dresses I was making at the time would still be relevant in the 21st century. I am amazed that, as I celebrate the 40th anniversary of the dress in 2014, my little creation is still being worn by young women across the globe.

title: Whats So Funny?
description: This year, the world became just a tad more crazy, sick and difficult to understand. A man who is not confused is not well informed, goes the old Irish saying, and that has never been more true. Economists, journalists, psychologists and other poor souls who deal with the hard questions of daily life  with no relief in sight  have no easy answers to offer.

title: Notable Childrens Books of 2013
description: YOUNG ADULT

title: Wrath, Lust and Other Punch Lines
description: Gigi Levangies latest black comedy is a set of scathing parables about the seven deadly sins, which are made a bit deadlier by the filthy-rich Beverly Hills ambience that the author can skewer so well. Ms. Levangie, now using this nom de divorce after writing her funnier books (Maneater, The Starter Wife) as Gigi Levangie Grazer, can be hit or miss, especially when she has a plot to concoct. But Seven Deadlies requires no such exertion. Its not much more than a set of seven meanspirited stories about what sin and wretched excess can do.

title: 2013: The Year in Images
description: A look at events around the world from the past year.

title: A Record Store Rises
description: Stephen Mallon, a visual artist, shot a behind-the-scenes preparations for the opening of Rough Trades first flagship store in the U.S. on November 25th.

title: Council Bill Aims to Limit Use of E-Cigarettes as Their Popularity Grows
description: The City Council is seeking to add electronic cigarettes to New Yorks ban on smoking in public places.

title: Global Agenda
description: What the editors of Turning Points look forward to in 2014.

title: The Dead Return. They Need Hobbies.
description: The word zombie is thrown around a lot in reference to The Returned, the spooky French series whose first season has hit the halfway point on Sundance Channel. Its even been called the French Walking Dead. But its not really a zombie show. Only one character eats flesh, and he started doing it while he was still alive. When an undead girl says, Zombies have to stick together, her smile tells you that she considers herself anything but.

title: What Becomes a Diva Most?
description: On a recent Friday afternoon, the soprano Lisette Oropesa was standing in a mirrored changing room inside the Metropolitan Operas costume department playing with her wedding veil. The costume designer Brigitte Reiffenstuel looked on critically, stepping back as far as possible within the cramped space. Elise Aragon, a draper, knelt at the sopranos feet with pins cupped in her hand. Ms. Oropesa fluffed the veil with her hands and allowed the diaphanous material to settle like a mist around her face.
